content: 1 The Revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave to him､ to point out unto his servants the things which must needs come to pass with speed,— and he shewed them by signs､ sending through his messenger､ unto his servant John;
content_old: 1 The Revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave to him､ to point out unto his servants the things which must needs come to pass with speed,— and he shewed them by signs､ sending through his messenger､ unto his servant John;

content: 2 who bare witness as to the word of God､ and the witness of Jesus Christ,— whatsoever things he saw.
content_old: 2 who bare witness as to the word of God､ and the witness of Jesus Christ,— whatsoever things he saw.

content: 3 Happy! he that readeth､ and they who hear､ the words of the prophecy, and keep the things therein written; for the season is near.
content_old: 3 Happy! he that readeth､ and they who hear､ the words of the prophecy, and keep the things therein written; for the season is near.

content: 4 John unto the Seven Assemblies which are in Asia Favour to you､ and peace, from— Him who Is､ And who Was､ and who is Coming, and from— The Seven Spirits which are before his throne,
content_old: 4 John unto the Seven Assemblies which are in Asia Favour to you､ and peace, from— Him who Is､ And who Was､ and who is Coming, and from— The Seven Spirits which are before his throne,

content: 5 and from— Jesus Christ,— The Faithful Witness､ The Firstborn of the Dead, and The Ruler of the Kings of the Earth. Unto him that loveth us､ and loosed us out of our sins with his blood,—
content_old: 5 and from— Jesus Christ,— The Faithful Witness､ The Firstborn of the Dead, and The Ruler of the Kings of the Earth. Unto him that loveth us､ and loosed us out of our sins with his blood,—

content: 6 and he hath made us to be a kingdom—priests unto his God and Father Unto him be the glory､ and the dominion, unto the ages. Amen.
content_old: 6 and he hath made us to be a kingdom—priests unto his God and Father Unto him be the glory､ and the dominion, unto the ages. Amen.

content: 7 Lo! he cometh with the clouds, and every eye shall see him､ such also as pierced him; and all the tribes of the land shall smite themselves for him. Yea! Amen.
content_old: 7 Lo! he cometh with the clouds, and every eye shall see him､ such also as pierced him; and all the tribes of the land shall smite themselves for him. Yea! Amen.

content: 8 I am the A､ and the Z, saith the Lord,—the God who Is､ and who Was､ and who is Coming, The Almighty.
content_old: 8 I am the A､ and the Z, saith the Lord,—the God who Is､ and who Was､ and who is Coming, The Almighty.

content: 9 I､ John your brother､ and partaker with you in the tribulation and kingdom and endurance in Jesus came to be in the isle that is called Patmos, because of the word of God､ and the witness of Jesus.
content_old: 9 I､ John your brother､ and partaker with you in the tribulation and kingdom and endurance in Jesus came to be in the isle that is called Patmos, because of the word of God､ and the witness of Jesus.

content: 10 I came to be in Spirit､ in the Lord’s Day, and heard､ behind me､ a loud voice, as of a trumpet,
content_old: 10 I came to be in Spirit､ in the Lord’s Day, and heard､ behind me､ a loud voice, as of a trumpet,

content: 11 saying— What thou seest write in a scroll､ and send unto the Seven Assemblies,—unto Ephesus､ and unto Smyrna, and unto Pergamum,—and unto Thyatira､ and unto Sardis, and unto Philadelphia,—and unto Laodicea.
content_old: 11 saying— What thou seest write in a scroll､ and send unto the Seven Assemblies,—unto Ephesus､ and unto Smyrna, and unto Pergamum,—and unto Thyatira､ and unto Sardis, and unto Philadelphia,—and unto Laodicea.

content: 12 And I turned round､ to see the Voice which was speaking with me, and having turned I saw Seven Lamps of gold;
content_old: 12 And I turned round､ to see the Voice which was speaking with me, and having turned I saw Seven Lamps of gold;

content: 13 and in the midst of the lamps One like unto a Son of Man:— Clothed with a robe､ reaching to the feet､ and girt about at the breasts with a girdle of gold,
content_old: 13 and in the midst of the lamps One like unto a Son of Man:— Clothed with a robe､ reaching to the feet､ and girt about at the breasts with a girdle of gold,

content: 14 And his head and hair white､ like white wool—like snow, And his eyes like a flame of fire,
content_old: 14 And his head and hair white､ like white wool—like snow, And his eyes like a flame of fire,

content: 15 And his feet like unto glowing copper､ as if in a furnace refined､ And his voice like a sound of many waters,
content_old: 15 And his feet like unto glowing copper､ as if in a furnace refined､ And his voice like a sound of many waters,

content: 16 And having in his right hand seven stars, And out of his mouth a sharp､ two-edged sword going forth; And his whole appearance as when the sun shineth in its strength.
content_old: 16 And having in his right hand seven stars, And out of his mouth a sharp､ two-edged sword going forth; And his whole appearance as when the sun shineth in its strength.

content: 17 And when I saw him I fell at his feet as dead, and he laid his right hand upon me, saying— Do not fear! I am the First､ and the Last､
content_old: 17 And when I saw him I fell at his feet as dead, and he laid his right hand upon me, saying— Do not fear! I am the First､ and the Last､

content: 18 and the Living One,— And I became dead;— And lo! living am I､ unto the ages of ages, And have the keys of death and of hades.
content_old: 18 and the Living One,— And I became dead;— And lo! living am I､ unto the ages of ages, And have the keys of death and of hades.

content: 19 Write､ therefore— What things thou hast seen and what they are; And what things are about to come to pass after these things:
content_old: 19 Write､ therefore— What things thou hast seen and what they are; And what things are about to come to pass after these things:

content: 1 Unto the messenger of the assembly in Ephesus write:— These things saith he that holdeth the seven stars in his right hand, he that walketh in the midst of the seven lamps of gold:
content_old: 1 Unto the messenger of the assembly in Ephesus write:— These things saith he that holdeth the seven stars in his right hand, he that walketh in the midst of the seven lamps of gold:

content: 2 I know thy works, and thy toil､ and endurance, and that thou canst not bear bad men, and thou hast tried them who were affirming themselves to be apostles､ and they were not, and hast found them false;
content_old: 2 I know thy works, and thy toil､ and endurance, and that thou canst not bear bad men, and thou hast tried them who were affirming themselves to be apostles､ and they were not, and hast found them false;

content: 3 and thou hast endurance､ and hast borne for the sake of my name, and hast not grown weary.
content_old: 3 and thou hast endurance､ and hast borne for the sake of my name, and hast not grown weary.

content: 4 Nevertheless､ I have against thee､ that thy first love thou hast left.
content_old: 4 Nevertheless､ I have against thee､ that thy first love thou hast left.

content: 5 Remember､ therefore､ whence thou hast fallen, and repent､ and do thy first works; otherwise I come unto thee､ and will remove thy lamp out of its place, except thou repent.
content_old: 5 Remember､ therefore､ whence thou hast fallen, and repent､ and do thy first works; otherwise I come unto thee､ and will remove thy lamp out of its place, except thou repent.

content: 6 But this thou hast､ that thou hatest the works of the Nicolaitanes, which I also hate.
content_old: 6 But this thou hast､ that thou hatest the works of the Nicolaitanes, which I also hate.

content: 7 He that hath an ear let him hear what the Spirit is saying unto the assemblies. Unto him that overcometh—I will give unto him to eat of the tree of life､ which is in the paradise of God.
content_old: 7 He that hath an ear let him hear what the Spirit is saying unto the assemblies. Unto him that overcometh—I will give unto him to eat of the tree of life､ which is in the paradise of God.

content: 8 And unto the messenger of the assembly in Smyrna write:— These things saith the first and the last, who became dead､ and lived:
content_old: 8 And unto the messenger of the assembly in Smyrna write:— These things saith the first and the last, who became dead､ and lived:

content: 9 I know thy tribulation､ and destitution, nevertheless thou art rich, and the profane speech from among them who affirm that they themselves are Jews, and they are not､ but a synagogue of Satan.
content_old: 9 I know thy tribulation､ and destitution, nevertheless thou art rich, and the profane speech from among them who affirm that they themselves are Jews, and they are not､ but a synagogue of Satan.

content: 10 Do not fear the things which thou art about to suffer. Lo! the adversary is about to cast some of you into prison､ that ye may be tried, and may have tribulation ten days. Become thou faithful until death, and I will give thee the crown of life.
content_old: 10 Do not fear the things which thou art about to suffer. Lo! the adversary is about to cast some of you into prison､ that ye may be tried, and may have tribulation ten days. Become thou faithful until death, and I will give thee the crown of life.

content: 11 He that hath an ear let him hear what the Spirit is saying unto the assemblies. He that overcometh shall in nowise be injured by reason of the second death.
content_old: 11 He that hath an ear let him hear what the Spirit is saying unto the assemblies. He that overcometh shall in nowise be injured by reason of the second death.

content: 12 And unto the messenger of the assembly in Pergamum write:— These things saith he that hath the sharp､ two-edged sword:
content_old: 12 And unto the messenger of the assembly in Pergamum write:— These things saith he that hath the sharp､ two-edged sword:

content: 13 I know where thou dwellest, where the throne of Satan is; and thou art holding fast my name､ and didst not deny my faith､ even in the days of Antipas､ my witness, my faithful one, who was killed near you､ where Satan dwelleth.
content_old: 13 I know where thou dwellest, where the throne of Satan is; and thou art holding fast my name､ and didst not deny my faith､ even in the days of Antipas､ my witness, my faithful one, who was killed near you､ where Satan dwelleth.

content: 14 Nevertheless､ I have against thee､ a few things,—that thou hast there､ such as hold fast the teaching of Balaam,— who went on to teach Balak to throw a cause of stumbling before the sons of Israel, to eat idol-sacrifices and to ćommit lewdness:
content_old: 14 Nevertheless､ I have against thee､ a few things,—that thou hast there､ such as hold fast the teaching of Balaam,— who went on to teach Balak to throw a cause of stumbling before the sons of Israel, to eat idol-sacrifices and to ćommit lewdness:

content: 15 thus even thou hast such as hold fast the teaching of the Nicolaitanes in like manner.
content_old: 15 thus even thou hast such as hold fast the teaching of the Nicolaitanes in like manner.

content: 16 Repent､ therefore, otherwise I come unto thee speedily,—and will fight against them､ with the sword of my mouth.
content_old: 16 Repent､ therefore, otherwise I come unto thee speedily,—and will fight against them､ with the sword of my mouth.

content: 17 He that hath an ear let him hear what the Spirit is saying unto the assemblies. Unto him that overcometh I will give unto him of the hidden manna, and I will give unto him a white stone､ and upon the stone a new name written､ which no one knoweth, save he that receiveth it.
content_old: 17 He that hath an ear let him hear what the Spirit is saying unto the assemblies. Unto him that overcometh I will give unto him of the hidden manna, and I will give unto him a white stone､ and upon the stone a new name written､ which no one knoweth, save he that receiveth it.

content: 18 And unto the messenger of the assembly in Thyatira write:— These things saith the Son of God, who hath his eyes like a flame of fire, and his feet like unto glowing copper:
content_old: 18 And unto the messenger of the assembly in Thyatira write:— These things saith the Son of God, who hath his eyes like a flame of fire, and his feet like unto glowing copper:

content: 19 I know thy works, and thy love､ and faith､ and ministry､ and endurance,—and that thy last works are more than the first.
content_old: 19 I know thy works, and thy love､ and faith､ and ministry､ and endurance,—and that thy last works are more than the first.

content: 20 Nevertheless､ I have against thee､ that thou sufferest the woman Jezebel, she who calleth herself a prophetess､ and is teaching and leading astray my own servants to commit lewdness and to eat idol-sacrifices;
content_old: 20 Nevertheless､ I have against thee､ that thou sufferest the woman Jezebel, she who calleth herself a prophetess､ and is teaching and leading astray my own servants to commit lewdness and to eat idol-sacrifices;

content: 21 and I gave her time､ that she might repent, and she willeth not to repent out of her lewdness.
content_old: 21 and I gave her time､ that she might repent, and she willeth not to repent out of her lewdness.

content: 22 Lo! I cast her into a bed, and them who are committing adultery with her､ into great tribulation,—except they repent out of her works;
content_old: 22 Lo! I cast her into a bed, and them who are committing adultery with her､ into great tribulation,—except they repent out of her works;

content: 23 and her children will I slay with death;—and all the assemblies shall get to know､ that I am he that searcheth reins and hearts, and will give unto you､ each one､ according to your works.
content_old: 23 and her children will I slay with death;—and all the assemblies shall get to know､ that I am he that searcheth reins and hearts, and will give unto you､ each one､ according to your works.

content: 24 But unto you I say,—the rest who are in Thyatira as many as have not this teaching, such as have not come to know the deep things of Satan､ as they say I do not cast upon you any other burden;
content_old: 24 But unto you I say,—the rest who are in Thyatira as many as have not this teaching, such as have not come to know the deep things of Satan､ as they say I do not cast upon you any other burden;

content: 25 nevertheless what ye have hold fast､ till I shall have come.
content_old: 25 nevertheless what ye have hold fast､ till I shall have come.

content: 26 And he that overcometh､ and keepeth throughout my works I will give unto him authority over the nations;
content_old: 26 And he that overcometh､ and keepeth throughout my works I will give unto him authority over the nations;

content: 27 and he shall shepherd them with a sceptre of iron,—as vessels of earthenware are dashed in pieces:— as I also have received from my Father.
content_old: 27 and he shall shepherd them with a sceptre of iron,—as vessels of earthenware are dashed in pieces:— as I also have received from my Father.

content: 28 And I will give unto him the morning star.
content_old: 28 And I will give unto him the morning star.

content: 1 And unto the messenger of the assembly in Sardis write:— These things saith he that hath the seven Spirits of God､ and the seven stars: I know thy works,—that a name thou hast､ that thou art living､ and art dead.
content_old: 1 And unto the messenger of the assembly in Sardis write:— These things saith he that hath the seven Spirits of God､ and the seven stars: I know thy works,—that a name thou hast､ that thou art living､ and art dead.

content: 2 Become thou watchful, and strengthen the things that remain､ that were about to die; for I have not found thy works fulfilled before my God.
content_old: 2 Become thou watchful, and strengthen the things that remain､ that were about to die; for I have not found thy works fulfilled before my God.

content: 3 Remember､ therefore､ how thou hast received､ and didst hear, and keep it and repent. If then thou shalt not watch I will have come as a thief､ and in nowise shalt thou get to know during what sort of hour I will have come upon thee.
content_old: 3 Remember､ therefore､ how thou hast received､ and didst hear, and keep it and repent. If then thou shalt not watch I will have come as a thief､ and in nowise shalt thou get to know during what sort of hour I will have come upon thee.

content: 4 Nevertheless thou hast a few names､ in Sardis, which have not defiled their garments; and they shall walk with me in white, because they are worthy.
content_old: 4 Nevertheless thou hast a few names､ in Sardis, which have not defiled their garments; and they shall walk with me in white, because they are worthy.

content: 5 He that overcometh shall thus array himself in white garments, and in nowise will I blot out his name､ from the book of life; and I will confess his name before my Father､ and before his messengers.
content_old: 5 He that overcometh shall thus array himself in white garments, and in nowise will I blot out his name､ from the book of life; and I will confess his name before my Father､ and before his messengers.

content: 6 He that hath an ear let him hear what the Spirit is saying unto the assemblies.
content_old: 6 He that hath an ear let him hear what the Spirit is saying unto the assemblies.

content: 7 And unto the messenger of the assembly in Philadelphia write:— These things saith he that is holy, he that is true, he that hath the key of David, he that openeth and no one shall shut､ and shutteth and no one openeth:
content_old: 7 And unto the messenger of the assembly in Philadelphia write:— These things saith he that is holy, he that is true, he that hath the key of David, he that openeth and no one shall shut､ and shutteth and no one openeth:

content: 8 I know thy works,—lo! I have set before thee an open door, as to which no one can shut it,—that thou hast a little strength and hast kept my word､ and hast not denied my name.
content_old: 8 I know thy works,—lo! I have set before thee an open door, as to which no one can shut it,—that thou hast a little strength and hast kept my word､ and hast not denied my name.

content: 9 Lo! I give them of the synagogue of Satan､ who are affirming themselves to be Jews and are not,—but say what is false,—lo! I will cause them､ that they shall have come､ and shall bow down before thy feet, and shall get to know that I loved thee.
content_old: 9 Lo! I give them of the synagogue of Satan､ who are affirming themselves to be Jews and are not,—but say what is false,—lo! I will cause them､ that they shall have come､ and shall bow down before thy feet, and shall get to know that I loved thee.

content: 10 Because thou didst keep my word of endurance I also will keep thee out of the hour of trial､ which is about to come upon the whole habitable world､ to try them that dwell upon the earth.
content_old: 10 Because thou didst keep my word of endurance I also will keep thee out of the hour of trial､ which is about to come upon the whole habitable world､ to try them that dwell upon the earth.

content: 11 I come quickly: hold fast that which thou hast, that no one take thy crown.
content_old: 11 I come quickly: hold fast that which thou hast, that no one take thy crown.

content: 12 He that overcometh I will make him a pillar in the sanctuary of my God, and outside shall he in nowise go forth any more; and I will write upon him the name of my God､ and the name of the city of my God, the new Jerusalem､ which cometh down out of heaven from my God, and I will write upon him my new name.
content_old: 12 He that overcometh I will make him a pillar in the sanctuary of my God, and outside shall he in nowise go forth any more; and I will write upon him the name of my God､ and the name of the city of my God, the new Jerusalem､ which cometh down out of heaven from my God, and I will write upon him my new name.

content: 13 He that hath an ear let him hear what the Spirit is saying unto the assemblies.
content_old: 13 He that hath an ear let him hear what the Spirit is saying unto the assemblies.

content: 14 And unto the messenger of the assembly in Laodicea write:— These things saith the Amen､ the faithful and true witness the beginning of the creation of God:
content_old: 14 And unto the messenger of the assembly in Laodicea write:— These things saith the Amen､ the faithful and true witness the beginning of the creation of God:

content: 15 I know thy works;—that neither cold art thou､ nor hot: I would that cold thou hadst been､ or hot.
content_old: 15 I know thy works;—that neither cold art thou､ nor hot: I would that cold thou hadst been､ or hot.

content: 16 Thus because lukewarm thou art､ and neither hot nor cold I am about to vomit thee out of my mouth.
content_old: 16 Thus because lukewarm thou art､ and neither hot nor cold I am about to vomit thee out of my mouth.

content: 17 Because thou sayest Rich am I､ and have become enriched, and of nothing have I need, and knowest not that thou art the wretched one､ and pitiable､ and destitute､ and blind､ and naked
content_old: 17 Because thou sayest Rich am I､ and have become enriched, and of nothing have I need, and knowest not that thou art the wretched one､ and pitiable､ and destitute､ and blind､ and naked

content: 18 I counsel thee to buy of me､ gold refined by fire, that thou mayest become rich,—and white raiment､ that thou mayest array thyself, and the shame of thy nakedness may not be made manifest,—and eye-salve､ to anoint thine eyes, that thou mayest see.
content_old: 18 I counsel thee to buy of me､ gold refined by fire, that thou mayest become rich,—and white raiment､ that thou mayest array thyself, and the shame of thy nakedness may not be made manifest,—and eye-salve､ to anoint thine eyes, that thou mayest see.

content: 19 I as many as I tenderly love I convict and put under discipline: be zealous､ therefore､ and repent.
content_old: 19 I as many as I tenderly love I convict and put under discipline: be zealous､ therefore､ and repent.

content: 20 Lo! I am standing at the door､ and knocking; if anyone shall hearken unto my voice､ and open the door I will come in unto him､ and will sup with him､ and he with me.
content_old: 20 Lo! I am standing at the door､ and knocking; if anyone shall hearken unto my voice､ and open the door I will come in unto him､ and will sup with him､ and he with me.

content: 21 He that overcometh I will give unto him to take his seat with me in my throne, as I also overcame､ and took my seat with my Father in his throne.
content_old: 21 He that overcometh I will give unto him to take his seat with me in my throne, as I also overcame､ and took my seat with my Father in his throne.

content: 1 After these things I saw, and lo! a door set open in heaven; and the first voice which heard as of a trumpet speaking with me, saying— Come up hither! and I will point out to thee the things which must needs come to pass. After these things
content_old: 1 After these things I saw, and lo! a door set open in heaven; and the first voice which heard as of a trumpet speaking with me, saying— Come up hither! and I will point out to thee the things which must needs come to pass. After these things

content: 2 straightway I came to be in Spirit, and lo! a throne stood in heaven, and upon the throne was one sitting;
content_old: 2 straightway I came to be in Spirit, and lo! a throne stood in heaven, and upon the throne was one sitting;

content: 3 and he that was sitting was like in appearance to a jasper stone and a sardius, and there was a rainbow round about the throne, like in appearance unto an emerald.
content_old: 3 and he that was sitting was like in appearance to a jasper stone and a sardius, and there was a rainbow round about the throne, like in appearance unto an emerald.

content: 4 And round about the throne were four and twenty thrones; and upon the thrones four and twenty elders sitting, clothed in white garments, and upon their heads were crowns of gold.
content_old: 4 And round about the throne were four and twenty thrones; and upon the thrones four and twenty elders sitting, clothed in white garments, and upon their heads were crowns of gold.

content: 5 And out of the throne are coming forth lightnings､ and voices､ and thunderings; and there are seven torches of fire､ burning before the throne, which are the seven Spirits of God;
content_old: 5 And out of the throne are coming forth lightnings､ and voices､ and thunderings; and there are seven torches of fire､ burning before the throne, which are the seven Spirits of God;

content: 6 and before the throne is as a glassy sea､ like unto crystal. And in the midst of the throne､ and around the throne are four living creatures full of eyes､ before and behind;
content_old: 6 and before the throne is as a glassy sea､ like unto crystal. And in the midst of the throne､ and around the throne are four living creatures full of eyes､ before and behind;

content: 7 and the first living creature is like unto a lion, and the second living creature like unto a calf, and the third living creature hath the face as of a man, and the fourth living creature is like unto an eagle flying;
content_old: 7 and the first living creature is like unto a lion, and the second living creature like unto a calf, and the third living creature hath the face as of a man, and the fourth living creature is like unto an eagle flying;

content: 8 and the four living creatures each one of them have severally six wings, round about and within full of eyes; and they cease not, day and night saying— Holy! holy! holy! Lord, God､ the Almighty,— Who was and Who is and Who is coming.
content_old: 8 and the four living creatures each one of them have severally six wings, round about and within full of eyes; and they cease not, day and night saying— Holy! holy! holy! Lord, God､ the Almighty,— Who was and Who is and Who is coming.

content: 9 And whensoever the living creatures shall give glory､ and honour､ and thanksgiving､ unto him that sitteth upon the throne, unto him that liveth unto the ages of ages
content_old: 9 And whensoever the living creatures shall give glory､ and honour､ and thanksgiving､ unto him that sitteth upon the throne, unto him that liveth unto the ages of ages

content: 10 the four and twenty elders will fall down before him that sitteth upon the throne, and do homage unto him that liveth unto the ages of ages,—and will cast their crowns before the throne, saying—
content_old: 10 the four and twenty elders will fall down before him that sitteth upon the throne, and do homage unto him that liveth unto the ages of ages,—and will cast their crowns before the throne, saying—

content: 1 And I saw､ upon the right hand of him that was sitting upon the throne､ a scroll; written within､ and on the back, sealed up with seven seals.
content_old: 1 And I saw､ upon the right hand of him that was sitting upon the throne､ a scroll; written within､ and on the back, sealed up with seven seals.

content: 2 And I saw a mighty messenger, proclaiming with a loud voice— Who is worthy to open the scroll､ and to unloose the seals thereof?
content_old: 2 And I saw a mighty messenger, proclaiming with a loud voice— Who is worthy to open the scroll､ and to unloose the seals thereof?

content: 3 And no one was able in heaven､ or on earth､ or under the earth to open the scroll, or to look thereon.
content_old: 3 And no one was able in heaven､ or on earth､ or under the earth to open the scroll, or to look thereon.

content: 4 And I began to weep much､ because no one､ worthy was found, to open the scroll､ or to look thereon.
content_old: 4 And I began to weep much､ because no one､ worthy was found, to open the scroll､ or to look thereon.

content: 5 And one of the elders saith unto me— Do not weep! Lo! the lion that is of the tribe of Judah, the root of David, hath overcome､ to open the scroll and the seven seals thereof.
content_old: 5 And one of the elders saith unto me— Do not weep! Lo! the lion that is of the tribe of Judah, the root of David, hath overcome､ to open the scroll and the seven seals thereof.

content: 6 And I saw in the midst of the throne and of the four living creatures､ and in the midst of the elders a Lamb standing, showing that it had been slain,—having seven horns､ and seven eyes, which are the seven Spirits of God sent forth into all the earth.
content_old: 6 And I saw in the midst of the throne and of the four living creatures､ and in the midst of the elders a Lamb standing, showing that it had been slain,—having seven horns､ and seven eyes, which are the seven Spirits of God sent forth into all the earth.

content: 7 And he came, and at once took it out of the right hand of him that was sitting upon the throne.
content_old: 7 And he came, and at once took it out of the right hand of him that was sitting upon the throne.

content: 8 And when he took the scroll the four living creatures､ and the four-and-twenty elders､ fell down before the Lamb, having each one a harp､ and bowls of gold full of incense,— which are the prayers of the saints;
content_old: 8 And when he took the scroll the four living creatures､ and the four-and-twenty elders､ fell down before the Lamb, having each one a harp､ and bowls of gold full of incense,— which are the prayers of the saints;

content: 9 and they sing a new song, saying— Worthy art thou､ to take the scroll and to open the seals thereof; Because thou wast slain､ And didst redeem unto God by thy blood men out of every tribe､ and tongue､ and people､ and nation,
content_old: 9 and they sing a new song, saying— Worthy art thou､ to take the scroll and to open the seals thereof; Because thou wast slain､ And didst redeem unto God by thy blood men out of every tribe､ and tongue､ and people､ and nation,

content: 10 And didst make them､ unto our God､ a kingdom and priests,— And they reign on the earth.
content_old: 10 And didst make them､ unto our God､ a kingdom and priests,— And they reign on the earth.

content: 11 And I saw, and heard a voice of many messengers､ round about the throne and the living creatures and the elders､—and the number of them was myriads of myriads and thousands of thousands､—
content_old: 11 And I saw, and heard a voice of many messengers､ round about the throne and the living creatures and the elders､—and the number of them was myriads of myriads and thousands of thousands､—

content: 12 saying with a loud voice— Worthy is the Lamb that hath been slain, To receive the power､ and riches､ and wisdom��� and might､ and honour､ and glory､ and blessing.
content_old: 12 saying with a loud voice— Worthy is the Lamb that hath been slain, To receive the power､ and riches､ and wisdom��� and might､ and honour､ and glory､ and blessing.

content: 13 And every created thing which was in heaven､ and upon the earth､ and under the earth､ and upon the sea, and all the things in them heard I､ saying— Unto him that sitteth upon the throne､ And unto the Lamb Be the blessing､ and the honour､ and the glory､ and the dominion Unto the ages of ages!
content_old: 13 And every created thing which was in heaven､ and upon the earth､ and under the earth､ and upon the sea, and all the things in them heard I､ saying— Unto him that sitteth upon the throne､ And unto the Lamb Be the blessing､ and the honour､ and the glory､ and the dominion Unto the ages of ages!

content: 1 And I saw when the Lamb opened one of the seven seals and I heard one of the four living creatures saying､ as with a voice of thunder— Go!
content_old: 1 And I saw when the Lamb opened one of the seven seals and I heard one of the four living creatures saying､ as with a voice of thunder— Go!

content: 2 And I saw, and lo! a white horse,— and he that was sitting thereon holding a bow; and there was given unto him a crown, and he went forth conquering､ and that he might conquer.
content_old: 2 And I saw, and lo! a white horse,— and he that was sitting thereon holding a bow; and there was given unto him a crown, and he went forth conquering､ and that he might conquer.

content: 3 And when he opened the second seal I heard the second living creature, saying— Go!
content_old: 3 And when he opened the second seal I heard the second living creature, saying— Go!

content: 4 And there went forth another､ a red horse,— and unto him that was sitting thereon it was given unto him to take away peace from the earth, and that one another they should slay; and there was given unto him a great sword.
content_old: 4 And there went forth another､ a red horse,— and unto him that was sitting thereon it was given unto him to take away peace from the earth, and that one another they should slay; and there was given unto him a great sword.

content: 5 And when he opened the third seal I heard the third living creature, saying— Go! And I saw, and lo! a black horse, and he that was sitting thereon holding a pair of balances in his hand.
content_old: 5 And when he opened the third seal I heard the third living creature, saying— Go! And I saw, and lo! a black horse, and he that was sitting thereon holding a pair of balances in his hand.

content: 6 And I heard as a voice in the midst of the four living creatures, saying— A quart of wheat､ for a denary, And three quarts of barley､ for a denary,— And the oil and the wine do not wrong.
content_old: 6 And I heard as a voice in the midst of the four living creatures, saying— A quart of wheat､ for a denary, And three quarts of barley､ for a denary,— And the oil and the wine do not wrong.

content: 7 And when he opened the fourth seal I heard the voice of the fourth living creature, saying— Go!
content_old: 7 And when he opened the fourth seal I heard the voice of the fourth living creature, saying— Go!

content: 8 And I saw, and lo! a livid horse,—and he that was sitting thereupon had for a name Death, and Hades was following with him; and there was given unto them authority over the fourth of the earth, to slay with sword､ and with famine､ and with death､ and by the wild beasts of the earth.
content_old: 8 And I saw, and lo! a livid horse,—and he that was sitting thereupon had for a name Death, and Hades was following with him; and there was given unto them authority over the fourth of the earth, to slay with sword､ and with famine､ and with death､ and by the wild beasts of the earth.

content: 9 And when he opened the fifth seal I saw､ beneath the altar､ the souls of them who had been slain because of the word of God and because of the witness which they held.
content_old: 9 And when he opened the fifth seal I saw､ beneath the altar､ the souls of them who had been slain because of the word of God and because of the witness which they held.

content: 10 And they cried out with a loud voice, saying— How long､ O Sovereign､ the Holy and True, dost thou not vindicate and avenge our blood from them that dwell upon the earth?
content_old: 10 And they cried out with a loud voice, saying— How long､ O Sovereign､ the Holy and True, dost thou not vindicate and avenge our blood from them that dwell upon the earth?

content: 11 And there was given to them､ each one､ a white robe, and it was bidden them､ that they should rest yet a little while— until the number should be made full of their fellow-servants also､ and their brethren､ who were about to be slain as even they.
content_old: 11 And there was given to them､ each one､ a white robe, and it was bidden them､ that they should rest yet a little while— until the number should be made full of their fellow-servants also､ and their brethren､ who were about to be slain as even they.

content: 13 and the stars of heaven fell to the earth､ as a fig-tree sheddeth her winter figs､ when by a great wind it is shaken,
content_old: 13 and the stars of heaven fell to the earth､ as a fig-tree sheddeth her winter figs､ when by a great wind it is shaken,

content: 14 and the heaven was withdrawn､ as a scroll rolling itself up, and every mountain and island out of their places were shaken.
content_old: 14 and the heaven was withdrawn､ as a scroll rolling itself up, and every mountain and island out of their places were shaken.

content: 15 And the kings of the earth､ and the great men､ and the rulers of thousands､ and the rich､ and the mighty､ and every bondman and freeman hid themselves within the caves and within the rocks of the mountains;
content_old: 15 And the kings of the earth､ and the great men､ and the rulers of thousands､ and the rich､ and the mighty､ and every bondman and freeman hid themselves within the caves and within the rocks of the mountains;

content: 16 and they say､ unto the mountains and unto the rocks— Fall upon us､ and hide us from the face of him that sitteth upon the throne, and from the anger of the Lamb;
content_old: 16 and they say､ unto the mountains and unto the rocks— Fall upon us､ and hide us from the face of him that sitteth upon the throne, and from the anger of the Lamb;

content: 1 After this I saw four messengers､ standing at the four corners of the earth, holding fast the four winds of the earth､ that no wind might blow upon the land､ or upon the sea､ or upon any tree.

content: 2 And I saw another messenger､ ascending from the rising of the sun, holding the seal of the Living God; and he cried out with a loud voice unto the four messengers unto whom it had been given to injure the land and the sea,
content_old: 2 And I saw another messenger､ ascending from the rising of the sun, holding the seal of the Living God; and he cried out with a loud voice unto the four messengers unto whom it had been given to injure the land and the sea,

content: 3 saying— Do not injure the land､ or the sea､ or the trees, until we have sealed the servants of our God upon their foreheads.
content_old: 3 saying— Do not injure the land､ or the sea､ or the trees, until we have sealed the servants of our God upon their foreheads.

content: 4 And I heard the number of the sealed,—a hundred and forty-four thousand,— sealed out of every tribe of the sons of Israel:—
content_old: 4 And I heard the number of the sealed,—a hundred and forty-four thousand,— sealed out of every tribe of the sons of Israel:—

content: 5 Of the tribe of Judah twelve thousand､ sealed, Of the tribe of Reuben twelve thousand､ Of the tribe of Gad twelve thousand,
content_old: 5 Of the tribe of Judah twelve thousand､ sealed, Of the tribe of Reuben twelve thousand､ Of the tribe of Gad twelve thousand,

content: 6 Of the tribe of Asher twelve thousand､ Of the tribe of Naphtali twelve thousand､ Of the tribe of Manasseh twelve thousand,

content: 7 Of the tribe of Simeon twelve thousand､ Of the tribe of Levi twelve thousand､ Of the tribe of Issachar twelve thousand,

content: 8 Of the tribe of Zebulun twelve thousand､ Of the tribe of Joseph twelve thousand､ Of the tribe of Benjamin twelve thousand sealed.

content: 9 After these things I saw, and lo! a great multitude,—which､ to number it! no one was able,—of every nation､ and of all tribes､ and peoples､ and tongues; standing before the throne､ and before the Lamb; arrayed in white robes､ and palm-branches in their hands;—
content_old: 9 After these things I saw, and lo! a great multitude,—which､ to number it! no one was able,—of every nation､ and of all tribes､ and peoples､ and tongues; standing before the throne､ and before the Lamb; arrayed in white robes､ and palm-branches in their hands;—

content: 10 and they cry out with a loud voice, saying— Salvation unto our God who sitteth upon the throne, and unto the Lamb!
content_old: 10 and they cry out with a loud voice, saying— Salvation unto our God who sitteth upon the throne, and unto the Lamb!

content: 11 And all the messengers were standing round about the throne and the elders and the four living creatures; and they fell down before the throne upon their faces, and rendered homage unto God,
content_old: 11 And all the messengers were standing round about the throne and the elders and the four living creatures; and they fell down before the throne upon their faces, and rendered homage unto God,

content: 12 saying— Amen! The blessing､ and the glory､ and the wisdom, and the thanksgiving､ and the honour､ and the power､ and the might,— Be unto our God､ unto the ages of ages. Amen!
content_old: 12 saying— Amen! The blessing､ and the glory､ and the wisdom, and the thanksgiving､ and the honour､ and the power､ and the might,— Be unto our God､ unto the ages of ages. Amen!

content: 13 And one of the elders began, saying unto me— These who are arrayed in white robes who are they? and whence came they?
content_old: 13 And one of the elders began, saying unto me— These who are arrayed in white robes who are they? and whence came they?

content: 14 And I at once said to him— My lord! thou knowest! And he said unto me— These are they who come out of the great tribulation, and they washed their robes､ and made them white in the blood of the Lamb;
content_old: 14 And I at once said to him— My lord! thou knowest! And he said unto me— These are they who come out of the great tribulation, and they washed their robes､ and made them white in the blood of the Lamb;

content: 15 For this cause are they before the throne of God､ and are rendering divine service unto him､ day and night､ in his sanctuary; and he that sitteth upon the throne shall spread his tent over them;
content_old: 15 For this cause are they before the throne of God､ and are rendering divine service unto him､ day and night､ in his sanctuary; and he that sitteth upon the throne shall spread his tent over them;

content: 16 They shall hunger no more､ Neither thirst any more, Neither in any wise shall the sun fall upon them､ nor any burning heat;
content_old: 16 They shall hunger no more､ Neither thirst any more, Neither in any wise shall the sun fall upon them､ nor any burning heat;

content: 1 And as soon as he opened the seventh seal there came to be silence in heaven､ as it were half an hour.
content_old: 1 And as soon as he opened the seventh seal there came to be silence in heaven､ as it were half an hour.

content: 2 And I saw the seven messengers which before God do stand; and there were given unto them seven trumpets.
content_old: 2 And I saw the seven messengers which before God do stand; and there were given unto them seven trumpets.

content: 3 And another messenger came､ and took his stand at the altar, having a censer of gold: and there was given unto him much incense, that he might give it unto the prayers of all the saints､ upon the altar of gold that is before the throne.
content_old: 3 And another messenger came､ and took his stand at the altar, having a censer of gold: and there was given unto him much incense, that he might give it unto the prayers of all the saints､ upon the altar of gold that is before the throne.

content: 4 And the smoke of the incense went up､ with the prayers of the saints､ out of the hand of the messenger before God.
content_old: 4 And the smoke of the incense went up､ with the prayers of the saints､ out of the hand of the messenger before God.

content: 5 And the messenger at once took the censer､ and filled it from the fire of the altar, and cast unto the earth; and there came to be thunderings､ and voices､ and lightnings､ and an earthquake.
content_old: 5 And the messenger at once took the censer､ and filled it from the fire of the altar, and cast unto the earth; and there came to be thunderings､ and voices､ and lightnings､ and an earthquake.

content: 6 And the seven messengers who had the seven trumpets prepared themselves､ that they might sound.
content_old: 6 And the seven messengers who had the seven trumpets prepared themselves､ that they might sound.

content: 7 And the first sounded; and there came to be hail and fire mingled with blood, and it was cast unto the earth; and the third of the earth was burned up, and the third of the trees was burned up, and all green herbage was burned up.
content_old: 7 And the first sounded; and there came to be hail and fire mingled with blood, and it was cast unto the earth; and the third of the earth was burned up, and the third of the trees was burned up, and all green herbage was burned up.

content: 8 And the second messenger sounded; and as it were a great mountain burning with fire was cast into the sea; and the third of the sea became blood,
content_old: 8 And the second messenger sounded; and as it were a great mountain burning with fire was cast into the sea; and the third of the sea became blood,

content: 9 and the third of the creatures which were in the sea､ which had life､ died, the third of the ships was destroyed.
content_old: 9 and the third of the creatures which were in the sea､ which had life､ died, the third of the ships was destroyed.

content: 10 And the third messenger sounded; and there fell､ out of heaven､ a great star､ burning as a torch, and it fell upon the third of the rivers､ and upon the fountains of waters.
content_old: 10 And the third messenger sounded; and there fell､ out of heaven､ a great star､ burning as a torch, and it fell upon the third of the rivers､ and upon the fountains of waters.

content: 11 And the name of the star is called Wormwood; and the third of the waters became wormwood, and many of the men died of the waters､ because they were made bitter.

content: 12 And the fourth messenger sounded; and the third of the sun was smitten､ and the third of the moon､ and the third of the stars,—in order that the third of them might be darkened, and the day might not shine for the third of it, and the night､ in like manner.

content: 1 And the fifth messenger sounded; and I saw a star､ out of heaven fallen unto the earth, and there was given unto him the key of the shaft of the abyss.
content_old: 1 And the fifth messenger sounded; and I saw a star､ out of heaven fallen unto the earth, and there was given unto him the key of the shaft of the abyss.

content: 2 And he opened the shaft of the abyss; and there came up a smoke out of the shaft､ as the smoke of a great furnace, and the sun and the air were darkened､ by reason of the smoke of the shaft.
content_old: 2 And he opened the shaft of the abyss; and there came up a smoke out of the shaft､ as the smoke of a great furnace, and the sun and the air were darkened､ by reason of the smoke of the shaft.

content: 3 And out of the smoke came forth locusts upon the earth; and there was given unto them licence, as the scorpions of the earth have licence.
content_old: 3 And out of the smoke came forth locusts upon the earth; and there was given unto them licence, as the scorpions of the earth have licence.

content: 4 And it was bidden them that they should not injure the herbage of the earth､ nor any green thing､ nor any tree,— but only the men who have not the seal of God upon their foreheads.
content_old: 4 And it was bidden them that they should not injure the herbage of the earth､ nor any green thing､ nor any tree,— but only the men who have not the seal of God upon their foreheads.

content: 5 And it was given unto them､ that they should not slay them, but that they should be tormented five months; and the torture of them was as of a scorpion’s torture､ whensoever it smiteth a man.
content_old: 5 And it was given unto them､ that they should not slay them, but that they should be tormented five months; and the torture of them was as of a scorpion’s torture､ whensoever it smiteth a man.

content: 6 And in those days shall men seek death､ and in nowise shall find it, and shall covet to die､ and death fleeth from them.

content_old: 7 And the likenesses of the locusts were like unto horses prepared for battle; and upon their heads as it were crowns､ like unto gold, and their faces were as the faces of men,

content: 8 and they had hair as the hair of women, and their teeth were as of lions,
content_old: 8 and they had hair as the hair of women, and their teeth were as of lions,

content: 9 and they had breastplates as breastplates of iron, and the sound of their wings was as the sound of chariots of many horses､ running into battle;
content_old: 9 and they had breastplates as breastplates of iron, and the sound of their wings was as the sound of chariots of many horses､ running into battle;

content: 10 and they have tails like unto scorpions､ and stings, and in their tails is their licence to injure men five months.

content: 11 They have over them as king the messenger of the abyss, whose name､ in Hebrew､ is Abaddôn “ Destroyer”, and in the Greek he hath for name Destroyer.
content_old: 11 They have over them as king the messenger of the abyss, whose name､ in Hebrew､ is Abaddôn “ Destroyer”, and in the Greek he hath for name Destroyer.

content: 14 saying unto the sixth messenger､ who was holding the trumpet— Loose the four messengers､ who are bound at the great river Euphrates.
content_old: 14 saying unto the sixth messenger､ who was holding the trumpet— Loose the four messengers､ who are bound at the great river Euphrates.

content: 15 And the four messengers were loosed, who had been prepared for the hour､ and day､ and month､ and year, that they should slay the third of men.
content_old: 15 And the four messengers were loosed, who had been prepared for the hour､ and day､ and month､ and year, that they should slay the third of men.

content: 16 And the number of the armies of the horsemen was twice ten thousand times ten thousand—I heard the number of them.
content_old: 16 And the number of the armies of the horsemen was twice ten thousand times ten thousand—I heard the number of them.

content: 17 And thus saw I the horses in the vision,—and them who were sitting upon them､ having breast plates as of fire and hyacinth and brimstone;—and the heads of the horses were as heads of lions, and out of their mouths come forth fire and smoke and brimstone:
content_old: 17 And thus saw I the horses in the vision,—and them who were sitting upon them､ having breast plates as of fire and hyacinth and brimstone;—and the heads of the horses were as heads of lions, and out of their mouths come forth fire and smoke and brimstone:

content_old: 18 by these three plagues were slain､ the third part of mankind, by reason of the fire and the smoke and the brimstone､ that proceedeth out of their mouths;

content: 19 for the licence of the horses is in their mouth､ and in their tails, for their tails are like unto serpents､ having heads, and with them they injure.

content: 20 And the rest of mankind who were not slain by these plagues repented not of the works of their hands,— that they should not do homage unto the demons, nor unto the idols of gold and of silver and of copper and of stone and of wood､ which can neither see nor hear nor walk;

content: 1 And I saw another､ a mighty messenger, descending out of heaven,—arrayed with a cloud, and the rainbow was upon his head, and his face was as the sun, and his feet were as pillars of fire,

content: 2 and he was holding in his hand a little scroll､ opened; and he set his right foot upon the sea､ and his left upon the land,
content_old: 2 and he was holding in his hand a little scroll､ opened; and he set his right foot upon the sea､ and his left upon the land,

content: 3 and cried out with a loud voice just as a lion roareth. And when he cried out the seven thunders uttered their own voices.
content_old: 3 and cried out with a loud voice just as a lion roareth. And when he cried out the seven thunders uttered their own voices.

content: 4 And when the seven thunders had spoken I was about to write, and I heard a voice out of heaven､ saying— Seal up the things which the seven thunders have uttered, and do not write them.
content_old: 4 And when the seven thunders had spoken I was about to write, and I heard a voice out of heaven､ saying— Seal up the things which the seven thunders have uttered, and do not write them.

content: 5 And the messenger､ whom I saw standing upon the sea and upon the land lifted up his right hand unto heaven,
content_old: 5 And the messenger､ whom I saw standing upon the sea and upon the land lifted up his right hand unto heaven,

content: 6 and sware by him that liveth unto the ages of ages, who created heaven､ and the things that are therein, and the earth､ and the things that are therein, and the sea､ and the things that are therein Delay no longer shall there be;

content: 7 but in the days of the sounding of the seventh messenger､ as soon as he is about to blow his trumpet then shall have been completed the sacred secret of God as he told the good-news unto his own servants the prophets.

content: 8 And the voice which I had heard out of heaven I again heard talking with me, and saying— Go take the opened scroll､ that is in the hand of the messenger who is standing upon the sea and upon the land.
content_old: 8 And the voice which I had heard out of heaven I again heard talking with me, and saying— Go take the opened scroll､ that is in the hand of the messenger who is standing upon the sea and upon the land.

content: 9 And I went away unto the messenger, asking him to give me the little scroll; and he saith unto me— Take it､ and eat it up; and it shall embitter thy belly, but in thy mouth shall be sweet as honey.
content_old: 9 And I went away unto the messenger, asking him to give me the little scroll; and he saith unto me— Take it､ and eat it up; and it shall embitter thy belly, but in thy mouth shall be sweet as honey.

content: 10 And I took the little scroll out of the hand of the messenger, and did eat it up; and it was in my mouth as honey sweet, and when I had eaten it embittered was my belly.
content_old: 10 And I took the little scroll out of the hand of the messenger, and did eat it up; and it was in my mouth as honey sweet, and when I had eaten it embittered was my belly.

content: 1 And there was given unto me a reed､ like unto a staff, saying— Rise､ and measure the Sanctuary of God, and the altar, and them who are doing homage therein;
content_old: 1 And there was given unto me a reed､ like unto a staff, saying— Rise､ and measure the Sanctuary of God, and the altar, and them who are doing homage therein;

content: 2 and the court that is outside the Sanctuary cast thou outside､ and do not measure it, because it hath been given unto the nations, and the holy city shall they tread under foot､ forty and two months.
content_old: 2 and the court that is outside the Sanctuary cast thou outside､ and do not measure it, because it hath been given unto the nations, and the holy city shall they tread under foot､ forty and two months.

content: 3 And I will give unto my two witnesses, that they shall prophesy､ a thousand two hundred and sixty days, arrayed in sack cloth.

content: 4 These are the two olive-trees､ and the two lamps､ which before the Lord of the earth do stand.
content_old: 4 These are the two olive-trees､ and the two lamps､ which before the Lord of the earth do stand.

content: 5 And if any one upon them chooseth to inflict injury fire cometh forth out of their mouth､ and devoureth their enemies; and if anyone shall choose upon them to inflict injury thus must he be slain.
content_old: 5 And if any one upon them chooseth to inflict injury fire cometh forth out of their mouth､ and devoureth their enemies; and if anyone shall choose upon them to inflict injury thus must he be slain.

content: 6 These have authority to shut heaven, in order that no rain be moistening in the days of their prophesying; and authority have they over the waters, to be turning them into blood, and to smite the land､ with any manner of plague as often as they will.

content: 7 And as soon as they have completed their witnessing the wild-beast that is to come up out of the abyss will make war with them, and overcome them､ and slay them.
content_old: 7 And as soon as they have completed their witnessing the wild-beast that is to come up out of the abyss will make war with them, and overcome them､ and slay them.

content: 8 And their dead bodies lie upon the broadway of the great city､ the which is called､ spiritually､ Sodom and Egypt, where their Lord also was crucified.
