content: 9 And some of the peoples､ and tribes､ and tongues､ and nations see their dead bodies three days and a half, and their dead bodies do they not suffer to be put into a tomb.
content_old: 9 And some of the peoples､ and tribes､ and tongues､ and nations see their dead bodies three days and a half, and their dead bodies do they not suffer to be put into a tomb.

content: 10 And they who are dwelling upon the earth rejoice over them､ and make merry, and gifts will they send one to another,— because these two prophets tormented them that were dwelling upon the earth.
content_old: 10 And they who are dwelling upon the earth rejoice over them､ and make merry, and gifts will they send one to another,— because these two prophets tormented them that were dwelling upon the earth.

content: 11 And after the three days and a half a spirit of life from God entered within them, and they stood upon their feet; and great fear fell upon them who were beholding them.
content_old: 11 And after the three days and a half a spirit of life from God entered within them, and they stood upon their feet; and great fear fell upon them who were beholding them.

content: 12 And they heard a loud voice out of heaven, saying unto them— Come up hither! And they went up into heaven､ in the cloud, and their enemies beheld them.
content_old: 12 And they heard a loud voice out of heaven, saying unto them— Come up hither! And they went up into heaven､ in the cloud, and their enemies beheld them.

content: 13 And in that hour there came to be a great earthquake; and the tenth of the city fell, and there were slain､ in the earthquake､ names of men—seven thousand. And the rest became greatly afraid, and gave glory unto the God of heaven.
content_old: 13 And in that hour there came to be a great earthquake; and the tenth of the city fell, and there were slain､ in the earthquake､ names of men—seven thousand. And the rest became greatly afraid, and gave glory unto the God of heaven.

content: 14 The second Woe hath passed away,—lo! the third Woe cometh speedily.
content_old: 14 The second Woe hath passed away,—lo! the third Woe cometh speedily.

content: 15 And the seventh messenger sounded; and there came to be loud voices in heaven, saying— The kingdom of the world hath become the kingdom of our Lord and of his Christ, and he shall reign unto the ages of ages.
content_old: 15 And the seventh messenger sounded; and there came to be loud voices in heaven, saying— The kingdom of the world hath become the kingdom of our Lord and of his Christ, and he shall reign unto the ages of ages.

content: 16 And the twenty-four elders who before God do sit upon their thrones fell down upon their faces, and rendered homage unto God,
content_old: 16 And the twenty-four elders who before God do sit upon their thrones fell down upon their faces, and rendered homage unto God,

content: 17 saying— We give thanks unto thee､ O Lord God, the Almighty, Who is､ and Who was; because thou hast taken thy great power, and hast become king.
content_old: 17 saying— We give thanks unto thee､ O Lord God, the Almighty, Who is､ and Who was; because thou hast taken thy great power, and hast become king.

content: 18 And the nations were angered; and thine anger came, and the fit time of the dead､ to be vindicated, and to give their reward unto thy servants the prophets､ and unto the saints､ and unto them who revere thy name—the small and the great, and to despoil them who were despoiling the earth.
content_old: 18 And the nations were angered; and thine anger came, and the fit time of the dead､ to be vindicated, and to give their reward unto thy servants the prophets､ and unto the saints､ and unto them who revere thy name—the small and the great, and to despoil them who were despoiling the earth.

content: 1 And a great sign appeared in heaven: a woman arrayed with the sun, and the moon beneath her feet, and upon her head a crown of twelve stars;
content_old: 1 And a great sign appeared in heaven: a woman arrayed with the sun, and the moon beneath her feet, and upon her head a crown of twelve stars;

content: 2 and she was with child, and crieth out､ being in pangs and in anguish to bring forth.
content_old: 2 and she was with child, and crieth out､ being in pangs and in anguish to bring forth.

content: 3 And there appeared another sign in heaven; and lo! a great red dragon,— having seven heads and ten horns, and upon his heads seven diadems;
content_old: 3 And there appeared another sign in heaven; and lo! a great red dragon,— having seven heads and ten horns, and upon his heads seven diadems;

content: 4 and his tail draweth the third part of the stars of heaven, and did cast them to the earth. And the dragon stood before the woman who was about to bring forth, that as soon as she should bring forth he might devour her child.
content_old: 4 and his tail draweth the third part of the stars of heaven, and did cast them to the earth. And the dragon stood before the woman who was about to bring forth, that as soon as she should bring forth he might devour her child.

content: 5 And she brought forth a son､ a manchild, who was about to shepherd all the nations with a sceptre of iron; and her child was caught away unto God and unto his throne.
content_old: 5 And she brought forth a son､ a manchild, who was about to shepherd all the nations with a sceptre of iron; and her child was caught away unto God and unto his throne.

content: 6 And the woman fled into the desert, where she hath a place prepared of God､ that there they should nourish her a thousand､ two hundred､ and sixty days.
content_old: 6 And the woman fled into the desert, where she hath a place prepared of God､ that there they should nourish her a thousand､ two hundred､ and sixty days.

content: 7 And there came to be war in heaven: Michael and his messengers going forth to war with the dragon; and the dragon fought, and his messengers;
content_old: 7 And there came to be war in heaven: Michael and his messengers going forth to war with the dragon; and the dragon fought, and his messengers;

content: 8 and he prevailed not, neither was place found for them､ any longer､ in heaven.
content_old: 8 and he prevailed not, neither was place found for them､ any longer､ in heaven.

content: 9 And the great dragon was cast out,—the ancient serpent, he that is called Adversary and the Satan, that deceiveth the whole habitable world,—he was cast to the earth, and his messengers with him were cast.
content_old: 9 And the great dragon was cast out,—the ancient serpent, he that is called Adversary and the Satan, that deceiveth the whole habitable world,—he was cast to the earth, and his messengers with him were cast.

content: 10 And I heard a loud voice in heaven, saying— Now hath come the salvation､ and the power､ and the kingdom of our God, and the authority of his Christ; Because the accuser of our brethren hath been cast out､ who was accusing them before our God day and night;
content_old: 10 And I heard a loud voice in heaven, saying— Now hath come the salvation､ and the power､ and the kingdom of our God, and the authority of his Christ; Because the accuser of our brethren hath been cast out､ who was accusing them before our God day and night;

content: 11 And they overcame him by reason of the blood of the Lamb､ and by reason of their witnessing word, and they loved not their life even unto death.
content_old: 11 And they overcame him by reason of the blood of the Lamb､ and by reason of their witnessing word, and they loved not their life even unto death.

content: 12 For this cause be joyful､ O heavens, and ye who therein are tabernacling. Woe! unto the earth､ and the sea､ because the Adversary hath come down unto you､ having great wrath—knowing that but a little season he hath.
content_old: 12 For this cause be joyful､ O heavens, and ye who therein are tabernacling. Woe! unto the earth､ and the sea､ because the Adversary hath come down unto you､ having great wrath—knowing that but a little season he hath.

content: 13 And when the dragon saw that he was cast to the earth he pursued the woman who had brought forth the manchild.
content_old: 13 And when the dragon saw that he was cast to the earth he pursued the woman who had brought forth the manchild.

content: 14 And there were given unto the woman the two wings of the great eagle, that she might fly into the desert､ into her place,—where she is nourished､ a season and seasons and half a season､ from the face of the serpent.
content_old: 14 And there were given unto the woman the two wings of the great eagle, that she might fly into the desert､ into her place,—where she is nourished､ a season and seasons and half a season､ from the face of the serpent.

content: 15 And the serpent cast out of his mouth､ after the woman､ water as a river, that he might cause her to be carried away by the stream.
content_old: 15 And the serpent cast out of his mouth､ after the woman､ water as a river, that he might cause her to be carried away by the stream.

content: 16 And the earth helped the woman, and the earth opened her mouth､ and swallowed up the river which the dragon cast out of his mouth.
content_old: 16 And the earth helped the woman, and the earth opened her mouth､ and swallowed up the river which the dragon cast out of his mouth.

content: 17 And the dragon was angered against the woman, and went away to make war with the rest of her seed—with them who were keeping the commandments of God､ and holding the witness of Jesus;—
content_old: 17 And the dragon was angered against the woman, and went away to make war with the rest of her seed—with them who were keeping the commandments of God､ and holding the witness of Jesus;—

content: 1 And I saw, out of the sea a wild-beast coming up; having ten horns､ and seven heads, and upon his horns ten diadems､ and upon his head names of blasphemy.
content_old: 1 And I saw, out of the sea a wild-beast coming up; having ten horns､ and seven heads, and upon his horns ten diadems､ and upon his head names of blasphemy.

content: 2 And the beast which I saw was like unto a leopard; and his feet as of a bear, and his mouth as the mouth of a lion. And the dragon gave unto him his power､ and his throne, and great authority.
content_old: 2 And the beast which I saw was like unto a leopard; and his feet as of a bear, and his mouth as the mouth of a lion. And the dragon gave unto him his power､ and his throne, and great authority.

content: 3 And I saw one of his heads､ showing that it had been slain unto death, and the stroke of his death was healed. And the whole earth marvelled after the wild-beast,
content_old: 3 And I saw one of his heads､ showing that it had been slain unto death, and the stroke of his death was healed. And the whole earth marvelled after the wild-beast,

content: 4 and did homage unto the dragon､ because he gave his authority unto the wild-beast; and they did homage unto the wild-beast, saying— Who is like unto the wild-beast? and Who can make war with him?
content_old: 4 and did homage unto the dragon､ because he gave his authority unto the wild-beast; and they did homage unto the wild-beast, saying— Who is like unto the wild-beast? and Who can make war with him?

content: 5 And there was given unto him､ a mouth speaking great things and blasphemies; and it was given unto him to act､ forty and two months.
content_old: 5 And there was given unto him､ a mouth speaking great things and blasphemies; and it was given unto him to act､ forty and two months.

content: 6 And he opened his mouth for blasphemy against God, to blaspheme his name､ and his tent,—them who in heaven were tabernacling.
content_old: 6 And he opened his mouth for blasphemy against God, to blaspheme his name､ and his tent,—them who in heaven were tabernacling.

content: 7 And it was given unto him､ to make war with the saints, and to overcome them; and there was given him､ authority against every tribe and people and tongue and nation.
content_old: 7 And it was given unto him､ to make war with the saints, and to overcome them; and there was given him､ authority against every tribe and people and tongue and nation.

content: 8 And all they who are dwelling upon the earth will do homage unto him,—every one whose name is not written in the scroll of life of the Lamb slain from the foundation of the world.
content_old: 8 And all they who are dwelling upon the earth will do homage unto him,—every one whose name is not written in the scroll of life of the Lamb slain from the foundation of the world.

content: 9 If anyone hath an ear let him hear.
content_old: 9 If anyone hath an ear let him hear.

content: 10 If anyone carrieth into captivity into captivity he goeth away. If anyone with a sword doth slay he must with a sword be slain. Here is the endurance and the faith of the saints.
content_old: 10 If anyone carrieth into captivity into captivity he goeth away. If anyone with a sword doth slay he must with a sword be slain. Here is the endurance and the faith of the saints.

content: 11 And I saw another wild-beast､ coming up out of the earth; and he had two horns､ like unto a lamb, and began speaking as a dragon.
content_old: 11 And I saw another wild-beast､ coming up out of the earth; and he had two horns､ like unto a lamb, and began speaking as a dragon.

content: 12 And all the authority of the first wild-beast he useth before him; and causeth the earth､ and them who therein are dwelling､ that they shall do homage unto the first wild-beast, whose stroke of death was healed.
content_old: 12 And all the authority of the first wild-beast he useth before him; and causeth the earth､ and them who therein are dwelling､ that they shall do homage unto the first wild-beast, whose stroke of death was healed.

content: 13 And he doeth great signs, so that even fire he causeth to be coming down unto the earth before men;
content_old: 13 And he doeth great signs, so that even fire he causeth to be coming down unto the earth before men;

content: 14 and he deceiveth them who are dwelling upon the earth､ by reason of the signs which it was given him to do before the wild-beast,—saying unto them who are dwelling upon the earth, that they should make an image unto the wild-beast who hath the stroke of the sword､ and yet did live.
content_old: 14 and he deceiveth them who are dwelling upon the earth､ by reason of the signs which it was given him to do before the wild-beast,—saying unto them who are dwelling upon the earth, that they should make an image unto the wild-beast who hath the stroke of the sword､ and yet did live.

content: 15 And it was given unto it､ to give spirit unto the image of the wild-beast, in order that the image of the wild-beast should both speak and should cause that as many as should not do homage unto the image of the wild-beast should be slain.
content_old: 15 And it was given unto it､ to give spirit unto the image of the wild-beast, in order that the image of the wild-beast should both speak and should cause that as many as should not do homage unto the image of the wild-beast should be slain.

content: 16 And he causeth all—the small and the great､ and the rich and the poor､ and the free and the bond,—that they should give unto them a mark､ upon their right hand or upon their forehead;
content_old: 16 And he causeth all—the small and the great､ and the rich and the poor､ and the free and the bond,—that they should give unto them a mark､ upon their right hand or upon their forehead;

content: 17 and that no one should be able to buy or to sell, save he that hath the mark, the name of the beast､ or the number of his name.
content_old: 17 and that no one should be able to buy or to sell, save he that hath the mark, the name of the beast､ or the number of his name.

content: 1 And I saw, and lo! the Lamb standing upon the mount Zion,—and with him a hundred and forty-four thousand, having his name and his Father’s name written upon their foreheads.
content_old: 1 And I saw, and lo! the Lamb standing upon the mount Zion,—and with him a hundred and forty-four thousand, having his name and his Father’s name written upon their foreheads.

content: 2 And I heard a sound out of heaven, as the sound of many waters､ and as the sound of loud thunders; and the sound which I heard was as of harp-singers harping with their harps.
content_old: 2 And I heard a sound out of heaven, as the sound of many waters､ and as the sound of loud thunders; and the sound which I heard was as of harp-singers harping with their harps.

content: 3 And they sing as it were a new song before the throne､ and before the four living creatures and the elders. And no one was able to learn the song､ save the hundred and forty-four thousand, who had been redeemed from the earth.
content_old: 3 And they sing as it were a new song before the throne､ and before the four living creatures and the elders. And no one was able to learn the song､ save the hundred and forty-four thousand, who had been redeemed from the earth.

content: 4 These are they who with women were not defiled, for they are virgin. These are they who follow the Lamb whithersoever he is going. These were redeemed from mankind､ as a firstfruit unto God and the Lamb;
content_old: 4 These are they who with women were not defiled, for they are virgin. These are they who follow the Lamb whithersoever he is going. These were redeemed from mankind､ as a firstfruit unto God and the Lamb;

content: 5 and in their mouth was found no falsehood,— faultless they are.
content_old: 5 and in their mouth was found no falsehood,— faultless they are.

content: 6 And I saw another messenger､ flying in mid-heaven, having an age-abiding glad-message to announce unto them who are dwelling upon the earth､ even unto every nation and tribe and tongue and people,
content_old: 6 And I saw another messenger､ flying in mid-heaven, having an age-abiding glad-message to announce unto them who are dwelling upon the earth､ even unto every nation and tribe and tongue and people,

content: 7 saying with a loud voice— Fear God and give him glory, because the hour of his judging is come; and do homage unto him that made heaven and the earth and sea and fountains of waters.
content_old: 7 saying with a loud voice— Fear God and give him glory, because the hour of his judging is come; and do homage unto him that made heaven and the earth and sea and fountains of waters.

content: 8 And another､ a second messenger followed, saying— Fallen! fallen! is Babylon the great, who of the wine of the wrath of her lewdness hath caused all the nations to drink.
content_old: 8 And another､ a second messenger followed, saying— Fallen! fallen! is Babylon the great, who of the wine of the wrath of her lewdness hath caused all the nations to drink.

content: 9 And another､ a third messenger followed them, saying with a loud voice— If anyone doeth homage unto the beast and his image, and receiveth a mark upon his forehead､ or upon his hand
content_old: 9 And another､ a third messenger followed them, saying with a loud voice— If anyone doeth homage unto the beast and his image, and receiveth a mark upon his forehead､ or upon his hand

content: 10 he also shall drink of the wine of the wrath of God, which is prepared､ unmixed､ in the cup of his anger;— and he shall be tormented with fire and brimstone､ before holy messengers and before the Lamb;
content_old: 10 he also shall drink of the wine of the wrath of God, which is prepared､ unmixed､ in the cup of his anger;— and he shall be tormented with fire and brimstone､ before holy messengers and before the Lamb;

content: 11 And the smoke of their torment unto ages of ages ascendeth; And they have no rest day or night､ who do homage unto the beast and his image, or if anyone receiveth the mark of his name.
content_old: 11 And the smoke of their torment unto ages of ages ascendeth; And they have no rest day or night､ who do homage unto the beast and his image, or if anyone receiveth the mark of his name.

content: 12 Here is the endurance of the saints,— they who keep the commandments of God and the faith of Jesus.
content_old: 12 Here is the endurance of the saints,— they who keep the commandments of God and the faith of Jesus.

content: 13 And I heard a voice out of heaven, saying—Write! Happy the dead who in the Lord do die from henceforth. Yea! (saith the Spirit) that they may rest from their toils, for their works do follow with them.
content_old: 13 And I heard a voice out of heaven, saying—Write! Happy the dead who in the Lord do die from henceforth. Yea! (saith the Spirit) that they may rest from their toils, for their works do follow with them.

content: 14 And I saw, and lo! a white cloud, and upon the cloud one sitting like unto a son of man､ having upon his head a crown of gold, and in his hand a sharp sickle.
content_old: 14 And I saw, and lo! a white cloud, and upon the cloud one sitting like unto a son of man､ having upon his head a crown of gold, and in his hand a sharp sickle.

content: 15 And another messenger came forth out of the sanctuary, crying out with a loud voice､ unto him that was sitting upon the cloud— Thrust in thy sickle､ and reap; because the hour to reap is come, because the harvest of the earth is ripe.
content_old: 15 And another messenger came forth out of the sanctuary, crying out with a loud voice､ unto him that was sitting upon the cloud— Thrust in thy sickle､ and reap; because the hour to reap is come, because the harvest of the earth is ripe.

content: 16 And he that was sitting upon the cloud thrust in his sickle upon the earth; and the earth was reaped.
content_old: 16 And he that was sitting upon the cloud thrust in his sickle upon the earth; and the earth was reaped.

content: 17 And another messenger came forth out of the sanctuary that is in heaven,—he also having a sharp sickle.
content_old: 17 And another messenger came forth out of the sanctuary that is in heaven,—he also having a sharp sickle.

content: 18 And another messenger came forth out of the altar, who hath authority over the fire,—and called out with a loud voice､ unto him who had the sharp sickle, saying— Thrust in thy sharp sickle, and gather the clusters of the vine of the earth; because the grapes thereof are fully ripe.
content_old: 18 And another messenger came forth out of the altar, who hath authority over the fire,—and called out with a loud voice､ unto him who had the sharp sickle, saying— Thrust in thy sharp sickle, and gather the clusters of the vine of the earth; because the grapes thereof are fully ripe.

content: 19 And the messenger thrust in his sickle into the earth, and gathered the vine of the earth､ and cast it into the great wine-press of the wrath of God.
content_old: 19 And the messenger thrust in his sickle into the earth, and gathered the vine of the earth､ and cast it into the great wine-press of the wrath of God.

content: 1 And I saw another sign in heaven､ great and marvellous,—seven messengers having seven plagues the last, because in them was ended the wrath of God.
content_old: 1 And I saw another sign in heaven､ great and marvellous,—seven messengers having seven plagues the last, because in them was ended the wrath of God.

content: 2 And I saw as a glassy sea mingled with fire, and them who escape victorious from the beast､ and from his image､ and from the number of his name, standing upon the glassy sea､ having harps of God;
content_old: 2 And I saw as a glassy sea mingled with fire, and them who escape victorious from the beast､ and from his image､ and from the number of his name, standing upon the glassy sea､ having harps of God;

content: 3 and they sing the song of Moses the servant of God and the song of the Lamb, saying— Great and marvellous are thy works, Lord､ God､ the Almighty! Righteous and true are thy ways, O King of the ages!
content_old: 3 and they sing the song of Moses the servant of God and the song of the Lamb, saying— Great and marvellous are thy works, Lord､ God､ the Almighty! Righteous and true are thy ways, O King of the ages!

content: 4 Who shall in anywise not be put in fear､ O Lord, and glorify thy name,— Because alone full of lovingkindness; Because all the nations will have come､ and will do homage before thee, Because thy righteous deeds were made manifest?
content_old: 4 Who shall in anywise not be put in fear､ O Lord, and glorify thy name,— Because alone full of lovingkindness; Because all the nations will have come､ and will do homage before thee, Because thy righteous deeds were made manifest?

content: 5 And after these things I saw, and the sanctuary of The Tent of Witness in heaven was opened ;
content_old: 5 And after these things I saw, and the sanctuary of The Tent of Witness in heaven was opened ;

content: 6 and the seven messengers who had the seven plagues came forth out of the sanctuary clothed with a precious stone､ pure､ bright, and girt about the breasts with girdles of gold.
content_old: 6 and the seven messengers who had the seven plagues came forth out of the sanctuary clothed with a precious stone､ pure､ bright, and girt about the breasts with girdles of gold.

content: 7 And one of the four living creatures gave､ unto the seven messengers､ seven golden bowls, full of the wrath of God who liveth unto the ages of ages.
content_old: 7 And one of the four living creatures gave､ unto the seven messengers､ seven golden bowls, full of the wrath of God who liveth unto the ages of ages.

content: 1 And I heard a loud voice､ out of the sanctuary､ saying unto the seven messengers— Go､ and be pouring out the seven bowls of the wrath of God unto the earth.
content_old: 1 And I heard a loud voice､ out of the sanctuary､ saying unto the seven messengers— Go､ and be pouring out the seven bowls of the wrath of God unto the earth.

content: 2 And the first departed､ and poured out his bowl unto the earth; and there came to be a baneful and painful ulcer､ upon the men who had the mark of the beast､ and them who were doing homage unto his image.
content_old: 2 And the first departed､ and poured out his bowl unto the earth; and there came to be a baneful and painful ulcer､ upon the men who had the mark of the beast､ and them who were doing homage unto his image.

content: 3 And the second poured out his bowl into the sea; and it became blood､ as of a dead man, and every living soul died— as regardeth the things in the sea.
content_old: 3 And the second poured out his bowl into the sea; and it became blood､ as of a dead man, and every living soul died— as regardeth the things in the sea.

content: 4 And the third poured out his bowl into the rivers､ and the fountains of waters; and they became blood.
content_old: 4 And the third poured out his bowl into the rivers､ and the fountains of waters; and they became blood.

content: 5 And I heard the messenger of the waters､ saying— Righteous art thou Who art､ and Who wast, Who art full of lovingkindness,—in that these things thou hast adjudged;
content_old: 5 And I heard the messenger of the waters､ saying— Righteous art thou Who art､ and Who wast, Who art full of lovingkindness,—in that these things thou hast adjudged;

content: 6 Because blood of saints and prophets poured they out, and blood､ unto them hast thou given to drink: Worthy they are!
content_old: 6 Because blood of saints and prophets poured they out, and blood､ unto them hast thou given to drink: Worthy they are!

content: 7 And I heard the altar､ saying— Yea! Lord､ God､ the Almighty: True and righteous are thy judgments!
content_old: 7 And I heard the altar､ saying— Yea! Lord､ God､ the Almighty: True and righteous are thy judgments!

content: 8 And the fourth poured out his bowl upon the sun; and it was given unto it､ to scorch mankind with fire;
content_old: 8 And the fourth poured out his bowl upon the sun; and it was given unto it､ to scorch mankind with fire;

content: 9 and mankind were scorched with a great scorching heat, and they blasphemed the name of God who had authority over these plagues､ and repented not to give him glory.
content_old: 9 and mankind were scorched with a great scorching heat, and they blasphemed the name of God who had authority over these plagues､ and repented not to give him glory.

content: 10 And the fifth poured out his bowl upon the throne of the beast; and his kingdom became darkened, and they began to gnaw their tongues by reason of the pain,—
content_old: 10 And the fifth poured out his bowl upon the throne of the beast; and his kingdom became darkened, and they began to gnaw their tongues by reason of the pain,—

content: 11 and they blasphemed the God of heaven､ by reason of their pain､ and by reason of their ulcers, and repented not of their works.
content_old: 11 and they blasphemed the God of heaven､ by reason of their pain､ and by reason of their ulcers, and repented not of their works.

content: 12 And the sixth poured out his bowl upon the great river the Euphrates; and the water thereof was dried up, that the way might be prepared､ of the kings who were from the rising of the sun.
content_old: 12 And the sixth poured out his bowl upon the great river the Euphrates; and the water thereof was dried up, that the way might be prepared､ of the kings who were from the rising of the sun.

content: 13 And I saw out of the mouth of the dragon､ and out of the mouth of the beast､ and out of the mouth of the false-prophet three impure spirits､ as frogs;
content_old: 13 And I saw out of the mouth of the dragon､ and out of the mouth of the beast､ and out of the mouth of the false-prophet three impure spirits､ as frogs;

content: 14 for they are spirits of demons､ doing signs, which are to go forth unto the kings of the whole habitable earth､ to gather them together unto the battle of the great day of God the Almighty.—
content_old: 14 for they are spirits of demons､ doing signs, which are to go forth unto the kings of the whole habitable earth､ to gather them together unto the battle of the great day of God the Almighty.—

content: 15 Lo! I come as a thief! Happy he that is watching､ and keeping his garments, lest naked he be walking､ and they see his shame.—
content_old: 15 Lo! I come as a thief! Happy he that is watching､ and keeping his garments, lest naked he be walking､ and they see his shame.—

content: 16 And he gathered them together unto the place that is called in Hebrew Har Magedôn.
content_old: 16 And he gathered them together unto the place that is called in Hebrew Har Magedôn.

content: 17 And the seventh poured out his bowl upon the air.—And there came forth a loud voice out of the sanctuary､ from the throne, saying— Accomplished!
content_old: 17 And the seventh poured out his bowl upon the air.—And there came forth a loud voice out of the sanctuary､ from the throne, saying— Accomplished!

content: 18 And there came to be lightnings､ and voices､ and thunders; and a great earthquake took place,—such as had never taken place since men came to be on the earth,— such a mighty earthquake､ so great;
content_old: 18 And there came to be lightnings､ and voices､ and thunders; and a great earthquake took place,—such as had never taken place since men came to be on the earth,— such a mighty earthquake､ so great;

content: 19 and the great city became divided into three parts, and the cities of the nations fell; and Babylon the Great was brought into remembrance before God, to give unto her the cup of the wine of the wrath of his anger;
content_old: 19 and the great city became divided into three parts, and the cities of the nations fell; and Babylon the Great was brought into remembrance before God, to give unto her the cup of the wine of the wrath of his anger;

content: 20 and every island fled, and mountains were not found.
content_old: 20 and every island fled, and mountains were not found.

content: 1 And one of the seven messengers who had the seven bowls came､ and spake with me, saying— Hither! I will point out to thee the judgment of the great harlot､ who sitteth upon many waters,
content_old: 1 And one of the seven messengers who had the seven bowls came､ and spake with me, saying— Hither! I will point out to thee the judgment of the great harlot､ who sitteth upon many waters,

content: 2 with whom the kings of the earth committed lewdness,—and they who were dwelling upon the earth were made drunk with the wine of her lewdness.
content_old: 2 with whom the kings of the earth committed lewdness,—and they who were dwelling upon the earth were made drunk with the wine of her lewdness.

content: 3 And he carried me away into a desert in spirit. And I saw a woman, sitting upon a scarlet wild-beast full of names of blasphemy､ having seven heads and ten horns.
content_old: 3 And he carried me away into a desert in spirit. And I saw a woman, sitting upon a scarlet wild-beast full of names of blasphemy､ having seven heads and ten horns.

content: 4 And the woman was arrayed with purple and scarlet､ and decked with gold and precious stone and pearls,—having a cup of gold in her hand､ full of abominations and the impurities of her lewdness;
content_old: 4 And the woman was arrayed with purple and scarlet､ and decked with gold and precious stone and pearls,—having a cup of gold in her hand､ full of abominations and the impurities of her lewdness;

content: 5 and upon her forehead a name written, a secret: Babylon the great, the Mother of the Harlots and of the Abominations of the earth.
content_old: 5 and upon her forehead a name written, a secret: Babylon the great, the Mother of the Harlots and of the Abominations of the earth.

content: 6 And I saw the woman､ drunk with the blood of the saints､ and with the blood of the witnesses of Jesus. And I was astonished､ when I beheld her､ with great astonishment.
content_old: 6 And I saw the woman､ drunk with the blood of the saints､ and with the blood of the witnesses of Jesus. And I was astonished､ when I beheld her､ with great astonishment.

content: 7 And the messenger said unto me— Wherefore wast thou astonished? I will tell thee the secret of the woman､ and of the wild-beast that carrieth her, which hath the seven heads and the ten horns.
content_old: 7 And the messenger said unto me— Wherefore wast thou astonished? I will tell thee the secret of the woman､ and of the wild-beast that carrieth her, which hath the seven heads and the ten horns.

content: 8 The wild-beast which thou sawest was､ and is not, and is about to come up out of the abyss､ and into destruction goeth away. And they who are dwelling upon the earth whose name is not written upon the book of life from the foundation of the world will be astonished, when they see the wild-beast, because it was､ and is not, and shall be present.
content_old: 8 The wild-beast which thou sawest was､ and is not, and is about to come up out of the abyss､ and into destruction goeth away. And they who are dwelling upon the earth whose name is not written upon the book of life from the foundation of the world will be astonished, when they see the wild-beast, because it was､ and is not, and shall be present.

content: 9 Here is the mind that hath wisdom. The seven heads are seven mountains whereupon the woman sitteth;
content_old: 9 Here is the mind that hath wisdom. The seven heads are seven mountains whereupon the woman sitteth;

content: 10 and they are seven kings: the five have fallen, the one is, the other hath not yet come; and whensoever he shall come a little while must he remain､
content_old: 10 and they are seven kings: the five have fallen, the one is, the other hath not yet come; and whensoever he shall come a little while must he remain､

content: 11 and the wild-beast which was and is not. And he is an eighth, and is of the seven,—and into destruction goeth away.
content_old: 11 and the wild-beast which was and is not. And he is an eighth, and is of the seven,—and into destruction goeth away.

content: 12 And the ten horns which thou sawest are ten kings,— who､ indeed､ have not received sovereignty as yet, but authority､ as kings､ for one hour shall receive､ with the wild-beast.
content_old: 12 And the ten horns which thou sawest are ten kings,— who､ indeed､ have not received sovereignty as yet, but authority､ as kings､ for one hour shall receive､ with the wild-beast.

content: 13 These have one mind, and their power and authority unto the wild-beast they give.
content_old: 13 These have one mind, and their power and authority unto the wild-beast they give.

content: 14 These with the Lamb will make war; and the Lamb will overcome them, because he is Lord of lords､ and King of kings,— and they who are with him are called and chosen and faithful.
content_old: 14 These with the Lamb will make war; and the Lamb will overcome them, because he is Lord of lords､ and King of kings,— and they who are with him are called and chosen and faithful.

content: 15 And he saith unto me— The waters which thou sawest､ where the harlot sitteth are peoples and multitudes and nations and tongues.
content_old: 15 And he saith unto me— The waters which thou sawest､ where the harlot sitteth are peoples and multitudes and nations and tongues.

content: 16 And the ten horns which thou sawest､ and the wild-beast these shall hate the harlot, and desoIate shall make her､ and naked, and herflesh shall they eat､ and herself shall they burn up with fire.
content_old: 16 And the ten horns which thou sawest､ and the wild-beast these shall hate the harlot, and desoIate shall make her､ and naked, and herflesh shall they eat､ and herself shall they burn up with fire.

content: 17 For God hath put into their hearts､ to do his mind, and to do one mind,—and to give their sovereignty unto the wild-beast, until the words of God shall be completed.
content_old: 17 For God hath put into their hearts､ to do his mind, and to do one mind,—and to give their sovereignty unto the wild-beast, until the words of God shall be completed.

content: 1 After these things I saw another messenger, coming down out of heaven,—having great authority; and the earth was illumined with his glory.
content_old: 1 After these things I saw another messenger, coming down out of heaven,—having great authority; and the earth was illumined with his glory.

content: 2 And he cried out､ with a mighty voice, saying— Fallen! fallen! in Babylon the Great, and hath become a habitation of demons､ and a prison of every impure spirit､ and a prison of every impure and hated bird;
content_old: 2 And he cried out､ with a mighty voice, saying— Fallen! fallen! in Babylon the Great, and hath become a habitation of demons､ and a prison of every impure spirit､ and a prison of every impure and hated bird;

content: 3 Because by reason of the wine of the wrath of her lewdness have all the nations fallen, and the kings of the earth with her did commit lewdness, and the merchants of the earth by reason of the power of her wantonness waxed rich.
content_old: 3 Because by reason of the wine of the wrath of her lewdness have all the nations fallen, and the kings of the earth with her did commit lewdness, and the merchants of the earth by reason of the power of her wantonness waxed rich.

content: 4 And I heard another voice out of heaven, saying— Come forth､ my people､ out of her,— that ye may have no fellowship with her sins, and of her plagues that ye may not receive;
content_old: 4 And I heard another voice out of heaven, saying— Come forth､ my people､ out of her,— that ye may have no fellowship with her sins, and of her plagues that ye may not receive;

content: 5 because her sins were joined together as far as heaven, and God hath remembered her unrighteous deeds.
content_old: 5 because her sins were joined together as far as heaven, and God hath remembered her unrighteous deeds.

content: 6 Render ye unto her､ As she also rendered, And double the double､ According to her works,— In the cup wherein she mixed Mix unto her double,—
content_old: 6 Render ye unto her､ As she also rendered, And double the double､ According to her works,— In the cup wherein she mixed Mix unto her double,—

content: 7 As much as she glorified herself､ and waxed wanton So much give unto her torment and grief:— Because in her heart she saith— I sit a Queen､ And widow am I not､ And grief in nowise shall I see!
content_old: 7 As much as she glorified herself､ and waxed wanton So much give unto her torment and grief:— Because in her heart she saith— I sit a Queen､ And widow am I not､ And grief in nowise shall I see!

content: 8 Therefore in one day shall have come her plagues,—death and grief and famine; and with fire shall she be burned up;—because mighty is the Lord God who hath judged her.
content_old: 8 Therefore in one day shall have come her plagues,—death and grief and famine; and with fire shall she be burned up;—because mighty is the Lord God who hath judged her.

content: 9 And they shall weep and wail over her—shall the kings of the earth who with her committed lewdness and waxed wanton,—as soon as they see the smoke of her burning,—
content_old: 9 And they shall weep and wail over her—shall the kings of the earth who with her committed lewdness and waxed wanton,—as soon as they see the smoke of her burning,—

content: 10 afar off standing､ because of their fear of her torment, saying— Alas! alas! the great city! Babylon､ the mighty city! That in one hour hath come thy judgment.
content_old: 10 afar off standing､ because of their fear of her torment, saying— Alas! alas! the great city! Babylon､ the mighty city! That in one hour hath come thy judgment.

content: 11 And the merchants of the earth weep and grieve over her, because their cargo no one buyeth any more:
content_old: 11 And the merchants of the earth weep and grieve over her, because their cargo no one buyeth any more:

content: 12 cargo of gold､ and silver､ and precious stone､ and pearls､ and fine linen､ and purple､ and silk､ and scarlet､ and all thyine wood, and every article of ivory､ and every article of wood most precious, and of copper､ and of iron､ and of marble,
content_old: 12 cargo of gold､ and silver､ and precious stone､ and pearls､ and fine linen､ and purple､ and silk､ and scarlet､ and all thyine wood, and every article of ivory､ and every article of wood most precious, and of copper､ and of iron､ and of marble,

content: 13 and cinnamon､ and spice､ and incense､ and unguent､ and frankincense､ and wine､ and oil, and fine flour､ and wheat, and cattle､ and sheep, and cargo of horses､ and of chariots､ and of bodies, and lives of men.
content_old: 13 and cinnamon､ and spice､ and incense､ and unguent､ and frankincense､ and wine､ and oil, and fine flour､ and wheat, and cattle､ and sheep, and cargo of horses､ and of chariots､ and of bodies, and lives of men.

content: 14 And the fruit of the coveting of thy soul Hath departed from thee, And all things rich and bright Have perished from thee; And no more､ in anywise､ for them shall they seek.
content_old: 14 And the fruit of the coveting of thy soul Hath departed from thee, And all things rich and bright Have perished from thee; And no more､ in anywise､ for them shall they seek.

content: 15 The merchants of these things､ who were enriched by her afar off shall stand､ because of their fear of her torment, weeping､ and grieving､
content_old: 15 The merchants of these things､ who were enriched by her afar off shall stand､ because of their fear of her torment, weeping､ and grieving､

content: 16 as they say— Alas! alas! the great city! She that was arrayed in fine linen､ and purple､ and scarlet, And decked with gold､ and precious stone､ and pearl,—
content_old: 16 as they say— Alas! alas! the great city! She that was arrayed in fine linen､ and purple､ and scarlet, And decked with gold､ and precious stone､ and pearl,—

content: 17 That in one hour hath been laid waste such great wealth as this! And every pilot､ and every passenger､ and mariners, and as many as by the sea carry on traffic afar off did stand,
content_old: 17 That in one hour hath been laid waste such great wealth as this! And every pilot､ and every passenger､ and mariners, and as many as by the sea carry on traffic afar off did stand,

content: 18 and they cried out､ seeing the smoke of her burning､ saying— What city is like unto the great city?
content_old: 18 and they cried out､ seeing the smoke of her burning､ saying— What city is like unto the great city?

content: 19 And they cast dust upon their heads, and cried out､ weeping and grieving､ saying— Alas! alas! the great city! Whereby were made rich all that had ships in the sea､ by reason of her costliness,— That in one hour she hath been laid waste!
content_old: 19 And they cast dust upon their heads, and cried out､ weeping and grieving､ saying— Alas! alas! the great city! Whereby were made rich all that had ships in the sea､ by reason of her costliness,— That in one hour she hath been laid waste!

content: 20 Be glad over her､ thou heaven! And ye saints､ and ye apostles､ and ye prophets! For that God hath exacted your vindication from her.
content_old: 20 Be glad over her､ thou heaven! And ye saints､ and ye apostles､ and ye prophets! For that God hath exacted your vindication from her.

content: 21 And one mighty messenger lifted a stone､ as it were a great millstone, and cast it into the sea, saying— Thus､ with main force shall be cast down､ Babylon the great city,— And in nowise be found any more;
content_old: 21 And one mighty messenger lifted a stone､ as it were a great millstone, and cast it into the sea, saying— Thus､ with main force shall be cast down､ Babylon the great city,— And in nowise be found any more;

content: 22 And sound of harp-singers､ and musicians､ and flute-players､ and trumpeters,— In nowise be heard in thee any more; And any artisan of any art,— In nowise be found in thee any more; And sound of millstone,— In nowise be found in thee any more;
content_old: 22 And sound of harp-singers､ and musicians､ and flute-players､ and trumpeters,— In nowise be heard in thee any more; And any artisan of any art,— In nowise be found in thee any more; And sound of millstone,— In nowise be found in thee any more;

content: 23 And light of lamp,— In nowise shine in thee any more; And voice of bridegroom and bride,— In nowise be heard in thee any more; Because thy merchants were the great ones of the earth, Because with thy sorcery were all the nations deceived:
content_old: 23 And light of lamp,— In nowise shine in thee any more; And voice of bridegroom and bride,— In nowise be heard in thee any more; Because thy merchants were the great ones of the earth, Because with thy sorcery were all the nations deceived:

content: 1 After these things I heard as it were､ a loud voice of a great multitude in heaven, saying— Hallelujah! The salvation and the glory and the power of our God!
content_old: 1 After these things I heard as it were､ a loud voice of a great multitude in heaven, saying— Hallelujah! The salvation and the glory and the power of our God!

content: 2 Because true and righteous are his judgments; Because he hath judged the great harlot, who､ indeed､ corrupted the earth with her lewdness,— And hath avenged the blood of his servants at her hand.
content_old: 2 Because true and righteous are his judgments; Because he hath judged the great harlot, who､ indeed､ corrupted the earth with her lewdness,— And hath avenged the blood of his servants at her hand.

content: 3 And a second time have they said— Hallelujah! And her smoke ascendeth unto ages of ages.
content_old: 3 And a second time have they said— Hallelujah! And her smoke ascendeth unto ages of ages.

content: 4 And the twenty-four elders and the four living creatures fell down､ and did homage unto God､ who sitteth upon the throne, saying— Amen! Hallelujah!
content_old: 4 And the twenty-four elders and the four living creatures fell down､ and did homage unto God､ who sitteth upon the throne, saying— Amen! Hallelujah!

content: 5 And a voice from the throne came forth, saying— Be giving praise unto our God､ all ye his servants, ye that revere him､ the small and the great.
content_old: 5 And a voice from the throne came forth, saying— Be giving praise unto our God､ all ye his servants, ye that revere him､ the small and the great.

content: 6 And I heard as a voice of a great multitude､ and as a voice of many waters､ and as a voice of mighty thunderings, saying— Hallelujah! Because the Lord､ our God､ the Almighty hath become king.
content_old: 6 And I heard as a voice of a great multitude､ and as a voice of many waters､ and as a voice of mighty thunderings, saying— Hallelujah! Because the Lord､ our God､ the Almighty hath become king.

content: 7 Let us rejoice and exult､ and give glory unto him, Because the marriage of the Lamb is come, and his wife hath made herself ready;
content_old: 7 Let us rejoice and exult､ and give glory unto him, Because the marriage of the Lamb is come, and his wife hath made herself ready;

content: 8 and it hath been given unto her､ that she should be arrayed in fine linen､ bright､ pure, for the fine linen is the righteous acts of the saints.
content_old: 8 and it hath been given unto her､ that she should be arrayed in fine linen､ bright､ pure, for the fine linen is the righteous acts of the saints.

content: 9 And he saith unto me— Write! Happy they who unto the marriage supper of the Lamb have been bidden! And he saith unto me— These words are true words of God.
content_old: 9 And he saith unto me— Write! Happy they who unto the marriage supper of the Lamb have been bidden! And he saith unto me— These words are true words of God.

content: 10 And I fell down at his feet､ to do him homage; and he saith unto me— See! thou do it not! A fellow-servant am I､ of thee and of thy brethren who have the witness of Jesus: unto God do homage! For the witness of Jesus is the spirit of the prophecy.
content_old: 10 And I fell down at his feet､ to do him homage; and he saith unto me— See! thou do it not! A fellow-servant am I､ of thee and of thy brethren who have the witness of Jesus: unto God do homage! For the witness of Jesus is the spirit of the prophecy.

content: 11 And I saw heaven､ set open､ and lo! a white horse, and he that was sitting thereon called Faithful､ and True; and in righteousness doth he judge and make war;
content_old: 11 And I saw heaven､ set open､ and lo! a white horse, and he that was sitting thereon called Faithful､ and True; and in righteousness doth he judge and make war;

content: 12 and his eyes are a flame of fire, and upon his head are many diadems, having a name written､ which no one knoweth､ but himself,
content_old: 12 and his eyes are a flame of fire, and upon his head are many diadems, having a name written､ which no one knoweth､ but himself,

content: 13 and arrayed with a mantle sprinkled with blood, and his name hath been called— The Word of God.
content_old: 13 and arrayed with a mantle sprinkled with blood, and his name hath been called— The Word of God.

content: 14 And the armies which were in heaven were following him､ upon white horses, clothed with fine linen､ white､ pure;
content_old: 14 And the armies which were in heaven were following him､ upon white horses, clothed with fine linen､ white､ pure;

content: 15 and out of his mouth is going forth a sharp sword, that therewith he may smite the nations,—and he shall shepherd them with a sceptre of iron, and he treadeth the wine-press of the wrath of the anger of God the Almighty.
content_old: 15 and out of his mouth is going forth a sharp sword, that therewith he may smite the nations,—and he shall shepherd them with a sceptre of iron, and he treadeth the wine-press of the wrath of the anger of God the Almighty.

content: 16 And he hath upon his mantle and upon his thigh a name written— King of kings, and Lord of lords.
content_old: 16 And he hath upon his mantle and upon his thigh a name written— King of kings, and Lord of lords.

content: 17 And I saw one messenger､ standing in the sun, and he cried out with a loud voice, saying unto all the birds that fly in mid-heaven— Hither! be gathered together unto the great supper of God,—
content_old: 17 And I saw one messenger､ standing in the sun, and he cried out with a loud voice, saying unto all the birds that fly in mid-heaven— Hither! be gathered together unto the great supper of God,—

content: 18 that ye may eat the flesh of kings, and the flesh of captains, and the flesh of mighty men, and the flesh of horses､ and of them who sit upon them, and the flesh of all､ both free and bond､ and small and great.
content_old: 18 that ye may eat the flesh of kings, and the flesh of captains, and the flesh of mighty men, and the flesh of horses､ and of them who sit upon them, and the flesh of all､ both free and bond､ and small and great.

content: 19 And I saw the wild-beast､ and the kings of the earth, and their armies､ gathered together— to make war with him who was sitting upon the horse､ and with his army.
content_old: 19 And I saw the wild-beast､ and the kings of the earth, and their armies､ gathered together— to make war with him who was sitting upon the horse､ and with his army.

content: 20 And the wild-beast was taken, and with him the false prophet who wrought the signs before him､ whereby he deceived them who received the mark of the wild-beast and them who were doing homage unto his image,—alive were they two cast into the lake of fire that burneth with brimstone.
content_old: 20 And the wild-beast was taken, and with him the false prophet who wrought the signs before him､ whereby he deceived them who received the mark of the wild-beast and them who were doing homage unto his image,—alive were they two cast into the lake of fire that burneth with brimstone.

content: 1 And I saw a messenger､ coming down out of heaven, having the key of the abyss､ and a great chain upon his hand;
content_old: 1 And I saw a messenger､ coming down out of heaven, having the key of the abyss､ and a great chain upon his hand;

content: 2 and he laid hold of the dragon､ the ancient serpent､ who is Adversary and the Accuser, and bound him for a thousand years,—
content_old: 2 and he laid hold of the dragon､ the ancient serpent､ who is Adversary and the Accuser, and bound him for a thousand years,—

content: 3 and cast him into the abyss, and fastened and sealed it over him,—that he might not deceive the nations any more､ until the thousand years should be ended: after these must he be loosed for a short time.
content_old: 3 and cast him into the abyss, and fastened and sealed it over him,—that he might not deceive the nations any more､ until the thousand years should be ended: after these must he be loosed for a short time.

content: 4 And I saw thrones､ and they sat upon them, and sentence of judgment was given unto them; and I saw the souls of them who had been beheaded because of the witness of Jesus and because of the word of God, and such as had not done homage unto the wild-beast or unto his image､ nor had received the mark upon their forehead or upon their hand; and they lived and reigned with the Christ､ for a thousand years.
content_old: 4 And I saw thrones､ and they sat upon them, and sentence of judgment was given unto them; and I saw the souls of them who had been beheaded because of the witness of Jesus and because of the word of God, and such as had not done homage unto the wild-beast or unto his image､ nor had received the mark upon their forehead or upon their hand; and they lived and reigned with the Christ､ for a thousand years.

content: 5 The rest of the dead lived not､ until the thousand years were ended. This is the first resurrection.
content_old: 5 The rest of the dead lived not､ until the thousand years were ended. This is the first resurrection.

content: 6 Happy and holy is he that hath part in the first resurrection: upon these the second death hath no authority; but they shall be priests of God and of the Christ, and shall reign with him for the thousand years.
content_old: 6 Happy and holy is he that hath part in the first resurrection: upon these the second death hath no authority; but they shall be priests of God and of the Christ, and shall reign with him for the thousand years.

content: 7 And as soon as the thousand years shall be ended the Accuser shall be loosed out of his prison,
content_old: 7 And as soon as the thousand years shall be ended the Accuser shall be loosed out of his prison,

content: 8 and will go forth to deceive the nations that are in the four corners of the earth､ the Gog and Magog､ to gather them together unto the battle—the number of whom is as the sand of the sea.
content_old: 8 and will go forth to deceive the nations that are in the four corners of the earth､ the Gog and Magog､ to gather them together unto the battle—the number of whom is as the sand of the sea.

content: 9 And they came up over the breadth of the land, and surrounded the camp of the saints､ and the beloved city. And there came down fire out of heaven, and devoured them;
content_old: 9 And they came up over the breadth of the land, and surrounded the camp of the saints､ and the beloved city. And there came down fire out of heaven, and devoured them;

content: 10 and the Adversary that had been deceiving them was cast into the lake of fire and brimstone, where were both the wild-beast and the false-prophet; and they shall be tormented､ day and night､ unto the ages of ages.
content_old: 10 and the Adversary that had been deceiving them was cast into the lake of fire and brimstone, where were both the wild-beast and the false-prophet; and they shall be tormented､ day and night､ unto the ages of ages.

content: 11 And I saw a great white throne､ and him that was sitting thereon, from whose face fled the earth and heaven､ and place was not found for them.
content_old: 11 And I saw a great white throne､ and him that was sitting thereon, from whose face fled the earth and heaven､ and place was not found for them.

content: 12 And I saw the dead､ the great and the small､ standing before the throne; and books were opened, and another book was opened､ which is the book of life; and the dead were judged out of the things written in the books according to their works.
content_old: 12 And I saw the dead､ the great and the small､ standing before the throne; and books were opened, and another book was opened､ which is the book of life; and the dead were judged out of the things written in the books according to their works.

content: 13 And the sea gave up the dead that were in it, and death and hades gave up the dead that were in them; and they were judged､ each one､ according to their works.
content_old: 13 And the sea gave up the dead that were in it, and death and hades gave up the dead that were in them; and they were judged､ each one､ according to their works.

content: 14 And death and hades were cast into the lake of fire. This is the second death—the lake of fire.
content_old: 14 And death and hades were cast into the lake of fire. This is the second death—the lake of fire.

content: 1 And I saw a new heaven and a new earth; for the first heaven and the first earth have passed away, and the sea is no more.
content_old: 1 And I saw a new heaven and a new earth; for the first heaven and the first earth have passed away, and the sea is no more.

content: 2 And the holy city､ new Jerusalem saw I coming down out of heaven from God, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.
content_old: 2 And the holy city､ new Jerusalem saw I coming down out of heaven from God, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.

content: 3 And I heard a loud voice out of the throne, saying— Lo! the tent of God is with men､ And he will tabernacle with them, And they shall be his peoples､ And he shall be God with them;
content_old: 3 And I heard a loud voice out of the throne, saying— Lo! the tent of God is with men､ And he will tabernacle with them, And they shall be his peoples､ And he shall be God with them;

content: 4 And he will wipe away every tear out of their eyes,— And death shall be no more, And grief and outcry and pain shall be no more: The first things have passed away.
content_old: 4 And he will wipe away every tear out of their eyes,— And death shall be no more, And grief and outcry and pain shall be no more: The first things have passed away.

content: 5 And he that was sitting upon the throne said— Lo! I make all things new. And he saith— Write! because these words are faithful and true.
content_old: 5 And he that was sitting upon the throne said— Lo! I make all things new. And he saith— Write! because these words are faithful and true.

content: 6 And he said unto me— Accomplished! I am the A､ and the Z, the Beginning and the End: I unto him that is thirsting will give of the fountain of the water of life freely:
content_old: 6 And he said unto me— Accomplished! I am the A､ and the Z, the Beginning and the End: I unto him that is thirsting will give of the fountain of the water of life freely:

content: 7 He that overcometh shall inherit these things,— And I will be to him a God, And he shall be to me a son;
content_old: 7 He that overcometh shall inherit these things,— And I will be to him a God, And he shall be to me a son;

content: 8 But as for the timid､ and disbelieving, and abominable､ and murderers, and fornicators､ and sorcerers､ and idolaters, and all the false their part is in the lake that burneth with fire and brimstone,— which is the second death.
content_old: 8 But as for the timid､ and disbelieving, and abominable､ and murderers, and fornicators､ and sorcerers､ and idolaters, and all the false their part is in the lake that burneth with fire and brimstone,— which is the second death.

content: 9 And there came one of the seven messengers which had the seven bowls､ that were full of the seven last plagues､ and spake with me, saying— Hither! I will point out to thee the bride､ the wife of the Lamb.
content_old: 9 And there came one of the seven messengers which had the seven bowls､ that were full of the seven last plagues､ and spake with me, saying— Hither! I will point out to thee the bride､ the wife of the Lamb.

content: 10 And he carried me away､ in spirit､ unto a mountain great and high, and pointed out to me the holy city､ Jerusalem､ coming down out of heaven from God;
content_old: 10 And he carried me away､ in spirit､ unto a mountain great and high, and pointed out to me the holy city､ Jerusalem､ coming down out of heaven from God;

content: 11 having the glory of God,—her lustre like unto a stone most precious, as a jasper stone､ shining as crystal;
content_old: 11 having the glory of God,—her lustre like unto a stone most precious, as a jasper stone､ shining as crystal;

content: 12 having a wall great and high, having twelve gates, and at the gates twelve messengers､ and names inscribed､ which are the names of the twelve tribes of the sons of Israel,—
content_old: 12 having a wall great and high, having twelve gates, and at the gates twelve messengers､ and names inscribed､ which are the names of the twelve tribes of the sons of Israel,—

content: 13 on the east three gates, and on the north three gates, and on the south three gates, and on the west three gates;
content_old: 13 on the east three gates, and on the north three gates, and on the south three gates, and on the west three gates;

content: 14 and the wall of the city having twelve foundations, and upon them twelve names of the twelve apostles of the Lamb.
content_old: 14 and the wall of the city having twelve foundations, and upon them twelve names of the twelve apostles of the Lamb.

content: 15 And he that was talking with me had､ for a measure､ a reed of gold, that he might measure the city､ and the gates thereof､ and the wall thereof.
content_old: 15 And he that was talking with me had､ for a measure､ a reed of gold, that he might measure the city､ and the gates thereof､ and the wall thereof.

content: 16 And the city four-square lieth, and the length thereof is as great as the breadth. And he measured the city､ with the reed,—twelve thousand furlongs: the length､ and the breadth､ and the height thereof are equal.
content_old: 16 And the city four-square lieth, and the length thereof is as great as the breadth. And he measured the city､ with the reed,—twelve thousand furlongs: the length､ and the breadth､ and the height thereof are equal.

content: 17 And he measured the wall thereof,— a hundred and forty-four cubits: the measure of a man, which is the measure of a messenger.
content_old: 17 And he measured the wall thereof,— a hundred and forty-four cubits: the measure of a man, which is the measure of a messenger.

content: 18 And the structure of the wall thereof was jasper, and the city was pure gold､ like unto pure glass.
content_old: 18 And the structure of the wall thereof was jasper, and the city was pure gold､ like unto pure glass.

content: 19 The foundations of the wall of the city with every precious stone were adorned: the first foundation was jasper, the second sapphire, the third chalcedony, the fourth emerald,
content_old: 19 The foundations of the wall of the city with every precious stone were adorned: the first foundation was jasper, the second sapphire, the third chalcedony, the fourth emerald,

content: 20 the fifth sardonyx, the sixth sardius, the seventh chrysolite, the eighth beryl, the ninth topaz, the tenth chrysoprase, the eleventh hyacinth, the twelfth amethyst;
content_old: 20 the fifth sardonyx, the sixth sardius, the seventh chrysolite, the eighth beryl, the ninth topaz, the tenth chrysoprase, the eleventh hyacinth, the twelfth amethyst;

content: 21 and the twelve gates were twelve pearls,—each one of the gates severally was of one pearl; and the broadway of the city was pure gold､ as transparent glass.
content_old: 21 and the twelve gates were twelve pearls,—each one of the gates severally was of one pearl; and the broadway of the city was pure gold､ as transparent glass.

content: 22 And sanctuary saw I none therein; for the Lord､ God､ the Almighty is the sanctuary thereof, and the Lamb.
content_old: 22 And sanctuary saw I none therein; for the Lord､ God､ the Almighty is the sanctuary thereof, and the Lamb.

content: 23 And the city hath no need of the sun､ nor of the moon, that they should shine therein; for the glory of God illumined it, and the lamp thereof was the Lamb.
content_old: 23 And the city hath no need of the sun､ nor of the moon, that they should shine therein; for the glory of God illumined it, and the lamp thereof was the Lamb.

content: 24 And the nations shall walk through her light; and the kings of the earth do bring their glory into it,
content_old: 24 And the nations shall walk through her light; and the kings of the earth do bring their glory into it,

content: 25 and the gates thereof shall in nowise be shut by day,—night in fact､ shall not be there,—
content_old: 25 and the gates thereof shall in nowise be shut by day,—night in fact､ shall not be there,—

content: 26 and they shall bring the glory and the honour of the nations into it.
content_old: 26 and they shall bring the glory and the honour of the nations into it.

content: 1 And he pointed out to me a river of water of life､ bright as crystal, issuing forth out of the throue of God and of the Lamb,
content_old: 1 And he pointed out to me a river of water of life､ bright as crystal, issuing forth out of the throue of God and of the Lamb,

content: 2 in the midst of the broadway thereof. And on this side of the river and on that was a tree of life､ bearing twelve crops of fruit, every several month yielding its fruit; and the leaves of the tree were for the healing of the nations.
content_old: 2 in the midst of the broadway thereof. And on this side of the river and on that was a tree of life､ bearing twelve crops of fruit, every several month yielding its fruit; and the leaves of the tree were for the healing of the nations.

content: 3 And no curse shall there be any more; and the throne of God and of the Lamb shall be therein,—and his servants will render divine service unto him,
content_old: 3 And no curse shall there be any more; and the throne of God and of the Lamb shall be therein,—and his servants will render divine service unto him,

content: 4 and they shall see his face, and his name shall be upon their foreheads.
content_old: 4 and they shall see his face, and his name shall be upon their foreheads.

content: 5 And night shall be no more; and they have no need of the light of a lamp or the light of a sun, because the Lord､ God will give them light,— and they shall reign unto the ages of ages.
content_old: 5 And night shall be no more; and they have no need of the light of a lamp or the light of a sun, because the Lord､ God will give them light,— and they shall reign unto the ages of ages.

content: 6 And he said unto me— These words are faithful and true; and the Lord､ the God of the spirits of the prophets hath sent his messenger､ to point out､ unto his servants､ the things which must needs come to pass with speed.
content_old: 6 And he said unto me— These words are faithful and true; and the Lord､ the God of the spirits of the prophets hath sent his messenger､ to point out､ unto his servants､ the things which must needs come to pass with speed.

content: 7 And— Lo! I come speedily! Happy is he that keepeth the words of the prophecy of this scroll.
content_old: 7 And— Lo! I come speedily! Happy is he that keepeth the words of the prophecy of this scroll.

content: 8 And I､ John am he that was hearing and seeing these things; and when I had heard and seen I fell down to do homage at the feet of the messenger who had been pointing out unto me these things,—
content_old: 8 And I､ John am he that was hearing and seeing these things; and when I had heard and seen I fell down to do homage at the feet of the messenger who had been pointing out unto me these things,—

content: 9 and he saith unto me— See thou do it not! A fellow-servant am I, of thee､ and of thy brethren the prophets､ and of them who keep the words of this scroll: unto God do homage.
content_old: 9 and he saith unto me— See thou do it not! A fellow-servant am I, of thee､ and of thy brethren the prophets､ and of them who keep the words of this scroll: unto God do homage.

content: 10 And he saith unto me— Do not seal up the words of the prophecy of this scroll, for the season is near:
content_old: 10 And he saith unto me— Do not seal up the words of the prophecy of this scroll, for the season is near:

content: 11 He that is doing unjustly let him do unjustly still, And he that is filthy let him be made filthy still; And he that is righteous let him do righteousness still, And he that is holy let him be hallowed still:—
content_old: 11 He that is doing unjustly let him do unjustly still, And he that is filthy let him be made filthy still; And he that is righteous let him do righteousness still, And he that is holy let him be hallowed still:—

content: 12 Lo! I come speedily, And my reward is with me､ to render unto each one as his work is.
content_old: 12 Lo! I come speedily, And my reward is with me､ to render unto each one as his work is.

content: 13 I am the A and the Z, The First and the Last, The Beginning and the End.
content_old: 13 I am the A and the Z, The First and the Last, The Beginning and the End.

content: 14 Happy they who are washing their robes, that their right may be unto the tree of life and by the gates they may enter into the city.
content_old: 14 Happy they who are washing their robes, that their right may be unto the tree of life and by the gates they may enter into the city.

content: 15 Outside are the dogs､ and the sorcerers､ and the unchaste､ and the murderers､ and the idolaters､ and every one loving and doing falsehood.
content_old: 15 Outside are the dogs､ and the sorcerers､ and the unchaste､ and the murderers､ and the idolaters､ and every one loving and doing falsehood.

content: 16 I､ Jesus have sent my messenger､ to bear witness unto you of these things, for the assemblies. I am the Root and the Offspring of David, The bright and the morning Star.
content_old: 16 I､ Jesus have sent my messenger､ to bear witness unto you of these things, for the assemblies. I am the Root and the Offspring of David, The bright and the morning Star.

content: 17 And the Spirit and the Bride say—Come! And he that heareth let him say—Come! And he that is athirst let him come,— He that will let him take of the water of life freely.
content_old: 17 And the Spirit and the Bride say—Come! And he that heareth let him say—Come! And he that is athirst let him come,— He that will let him take of the water of life freely.

content: 18 I bear witness､ unto every one that heareth the words of the prophecy of this scroll:— If anyone shall lay aught upon them God will lay upon him the plagues which are written in this scroll;
content_old: 18 I bear witness､ unto every one that heareth the words of the prophecy of this scroll:— If anyone shall lay aught upon them God will lay upon him the plagues which are written in this scroll;

content: 19 And if anyone shall take away from the words of this prophetic scroll God will take away his part— From the tree of life､ And out of the holy city,— From the things written in this scroll.
content_old: 19 And if anyone shall take away from the words of this prophetic scroll God will take away his part— From the tree of life､ And out of the holy city,— From the things written in this scroll.

content: 20 He that beareth witness of these things saith— Yea! I come speedily. Amen! come､ Lord Jesus!
content_old: 20 He that beareth witness of these things saith— Yea! I come speedily. Amen! come､ Lord Jesus!
